Reviews.Title: “Really wanted to like this inn but...”
Reviews.Author: bieme
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler, I like to find hotels that are convenient for work but still have some personality and charm. The Inn at St Botolph's seemed a perfect fit and, if it weren't for a few but significant let-downs, I would have rated this much higher. Disclaimer - I made my reservation through the online corporate travel agent, so the Inn's website may warn travelers of these things that I didn't see. First, the Inn allows smoking and the smell of smoke permeates the halls and rooms every night. If you stay when the weather is warm, opening your windows might alleviate this if you don't smoke (not an option in February). Second, if you find you have to cut your stay short you still must pay for the entire reserved stay. I could understand this policy for, say, a remote cabin or VRBO, but an urban inn in the center of Boston? Someone having to cut their stay short is likely experiencing a stressful situation already, this just adds to that stress. I also was unable to connect to the internet there using my company's computer - the staff did try to help and referred me to their provider's 800 number but, after an hour of trying, I chose not to keep pursuing it - caveat emptor if you're travelling on business. Other than these issues, the kitchen is nicely equipped while small, the bed comfortable and it's in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: JNABAker
Reviews.Content: We love this quiet Inn in a perfect location in downtown Boston. One block from "T" access at Prudential Center, easy walk to many of Boston's famous sights. We'll be back. The only thing that requires some thought is where to park if you're unwise enough to drive in this walkable city.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: sushi214
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I stayed at the Inn @ St Botolph on a Tuesday night after a Bruins game. When my fiancé called to see if there were any openings, Tom told us that the only room open was a suite on the 4th floor. Because we were only looking for a room and not a suite and we booked it the night of, he gave us almost a 50% discount. The suite was modern, clean, and extremely quiet. The architectural detail of the suite was amazing and it was tastefully decorated. Even though the Inn is only a block away from the Prudential Center, it was extremely quiet. Everyone we dealt with was very friendly and helpful, and we even received a coupon for 25% off at a variety of local restaurants. Continental breakfast was included and was a better display than most continental breakfasts at other hotels we have stayed at in the past. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “New favorite place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Angela D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business and now always want to stay here! It's located in beautiful Back Bay, just steps from the Prudential Center and in a beautiful, centrally located historical neighborhood. I was in town from Los Angeles doing some local casting on a film and have thoroughly enjoyed my stay at The Inn @ St. Botolph. The accommodations are beautiful and comfortable--truly a home away from home, and the staff is amazingly helpful and friendly. I highly recommend this place and can't wait to come back again very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Place to Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Ruby W
Reviews.Content: Quiet, even though it is at a busy intersection, Comfortable, clean, pleasant staff, continental breakfast. Close to many resturants and historical spots. Just great all around!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Boston!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SarahG1982
Reviews.Content: I received a recommendation from a friend about The Inn at St. Botolph. I have never been to Boston so I accepted the recommendation and I have never been happier with my choice! I received an e-mail notification prior to my arrival with check-in information. The keyless entry system is genius -- I felt very safe at the Inn. My husband and I were assigned Room 103. The room has a kitchenette, sitting area, fire place, and bedroom (see pictures). There was plenty of space to unwind! The hotel staff was excellent and provided great restaurant recommendations. The Inn also offers a complimentary breakfast which includes bagels, breakfast bars, refreshments, etc. The Inn is right across the street from The Prudential which has numerous shops and restaurants. The location of the Inn cannot be beat! We took a taxi from location to location simply because the weather was very, very cold (10 degrees) and since we were unfamiliar with the city we did not want to bother with trying to figure out the subway system. Overall, the experience was excellent and we will definitely be staying at The Inn at St. Botolph when we make it back to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Boston's namesake, classy, comfortable and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: TravelwithkidsSydney
Reviews.Content: Boston is named from St Botolph, the patron saint of travelers and this place is a little slice of heaven for independent travelers or locals looking for a quiet retreat in the city. Don't stay here if you want hotel services like concierge and room service. Staff are helpful but discreet. Fantastic location for shops and food. We loved our two bedroom one bathroom. Designers could have been more generous with lighting but this seems to be a standard problem in many hotels. Loved the free WiFi and guest laundry. Best espresso coffee machine in Lounge. I nearly cried to have the best coffee in the US since leaving Australia. Nestle pod machine. Breakfast options good start to the day and designed for you to take back to your room or as you run out the door. Kitchenette small but full size fridge and good supply of utensils and crockery. Grocery store 5 min walk under Prudential centre. Would definitely return if we ever go back to Boston. It is a great place. Smaller scale and more relaxed than NYC. Bring on the lobster!

Reviews.Title: “A great option for independent travelers”
Reviews.Author: TheBrisli
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great choice for us, as it was near the 'T', which gave us easy transport options, the Prudential Centre for browsing, and the lovely Newberry Street for shopping and dining. We stayed in 2 one bedroom suites, with 3 in one room and 2 in the other, as we are a family of 5. Our 181cm son coped with sleeping on the chaise lounge - just. We loved the sitting area in each suite, the lovely brownstone building, the continental breakfast in the downstairs lounge and the gentle suburban setting of the hotel. We didn't cook, but we could have. Only negative - the walls are a little thin. The keyless entry system worked really well for us, as we don't often utilize the services of a concierge. Huge positive - a laundry in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “If I come back to Boston, this is where I will stay”
Reviews.Author: debat144
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It is an unassuming building which blends into the row houses in its cute Back Bay neighborhood. The hotel is very small, with only 14(?) guestrooms. Location - wonderful: 2 blocks from the Prudential Center, an upscale shopping mall and its associated parking lots (hint: print out a parking lot coupon before paying, and you'll get reduced rates), and the same distance to the T station. Room - wonderful: We stayed in the smallest room, a studio suite. It had a comfortable bed, a well equipped kitchen, and a sophisticated, unfussy decor. I wanted to check out a 1-bedroom before we left, but ran out of time. Hotel amenities: a small fitness room with free water bottles; a guest laundry; a wonderful lounge with hot and cold drinks always available; and a friendly, helpful person always available in the office. Only complaint: the bathroom was really cold and there was no counter around the sink. Another comment: I had never been to an access-code hotel before. Right before we left home, I received an email with out hotel room and hotel main-door code. Although it takes a minute to tap in the code, and took me a few minutes to memorize it, we didn't have to check in or check out and didn't have to worry about losing the key. I know this feature bothers some people, but personally, I liked it. One other comment, important for people who like to pack light - the room had a hairdryer, although its not mentioned anywhere on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Jean R
Reviews.Content: A comfortable home away from home. Virtual reservation, check in and check out. Everything was top rate.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, private, well situated”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: The Inn at St. Botolph was a wonderfully comfortable and private place, given its proximity to the main Back Bay shopping destinations. (It is also perched on the border of the South End, should you be more interested in exploring that neighborhood.) The building is lovely, the street is charming, the rooms are spacious and quiet. We're always looking for somewhere with a table to work at and a kitchen to cook in, and the Inn's amenities (including free Wi-Fi) were perfect for us. We also really appreciated the staff's friendly and gracious service, especially the great help offered to us by Michael in the office.

Reviews.Title: “Simply: the "unique approach" doesn't work”
Reviews.Author: GMP60745
Reviews.Content: Yes, the interiors were designed very nicely, contemporary but toward comfort (the bedding was very nice). However, the lack of daily housecleaning services for longer stays is not simply less than luxurious, but frankly results in a room and entire hotel that felt less than clean. From the elevator, to the hallways (including signs and carpets, to most especially the room (and bathroom), the entire facility clearly reflected a lack of attention to detail and a need for daily cleaning. At this price level, and given the way they present themselves, The Inn At St. Botolph fell far short of my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Not so fancy, but does the job”
Reviews.Author: lovegreatplaces
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the thick of the action, this is probably not the hotel for you...but then maybe you should go to NYC instead of to Boston! The Inn is about 15 minutes walk from Boston Common, and two stops on the T (the Prudential Station T-stop is a minute walk from the Inn). I was a bit concerned about this when I first got to Boston, but after walking around found that the 'downtown' area was a bit shabby and dull anyway, compared to the Basck Bay area which is lovely. In all, the Inn is close to what you need - it is practically opposite the Prudential Centre, with food, shops, etc., and a few blocks from Newbury Street, which is pretty with all its fairy lights. On my first night I stayed in a 'one bedroom' suite, which was next to the lift, which was a bit noisy; on the others, I stayed in a studio, which was much better, though smaller (not a problem for solo traveller). In terms of breakfast - it is very simple, and could do with fresh fruit - which would be disappointing if you were in Boston for the cuisine, but I was not. Having a printer and a laundry were incredibly useful to me also. The Inn has a policy of not cleaning the rooms for stays less than a week unless requested. This was a bit of a pain (bins fill quickly when you're self-catering) but the staff were great when I asked for my room to be cleaned, extra coffee etc. I will stay here again if in Boston; the only other part of town that seemed an alternative was the North End.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and great location”
Reviews.Author: Judy B
Reviews.Content: Overall nice. Simple and nicely decorated. The couch in sitting room made a decent extra bed (which they made up for us ahead).. But it was located in the bay window area which was very chilly- was better when you pulled all three heavy drapes closed. We were on second floor overlooking St Botolph Street and it seemed pretty quiet all night. Only there one night, but the kitchenette would be great if we needed it. True that only 2 decaf, no regular, coffee packs were in our kitchenette, but the breakfast room did have espresso machine. Bath lighting was dim, but there was a lighted makeup mirror that you could plug in. Did not have any contact with the staff- the check-in was by email- all pretty convenient. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A week + 1”
Reviews.Author: SoCalGal92691
Reviews.Content: My stay was great and I will definitely be back! I was there for work, ended up needing to stay and extra night, needed to use the printer and scanner as well as get some direction as to local business services and the staff was excellent, accommodating and very nice. The Inn is super comfortable, like being at home and not stuck in boring hotel. This trip was for business but I would very much enjoy staying with guy as well - super location, spacious rooms, perfect for many different travel needs. Thanks everyone - you made my stay very easy and enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Nice idea, poor execution, really poor”
Reviews.Author: Lib76
Reviews.Content: I'm surprise this property rates so high, the room we were in was poorly lighted, not cleaned well (the carpet was filthy) and any contact that you have with the staff is curt and not too helpful. The walls are paper thin, you will a party to EVERYTHING occurring in the next rooms. And the street is deceptively quiet during the day but at night, it's a busy cut through for traffic you will hear it all due to the windows that seem not to block any sound at all. The exercise room is small. if you like on flavor of Danone yogurt and oatmeal and prefer only skim milk the "breakfast" is fine for you. For the price one would expect more, much more with all of the competing hotels around.

Reviews.Title: “just right”
Reviews.Author: dwpjr1
Reviews.Content: i look for quiet,small,locations where windows can be opened and located very near convention center. via prudential arcade. i had oatmeal, yogurt,banana with hotchocolateas fine breakfast. staff very helpful with ideas for eating, shaw's, running paths, storing luggage since i arrived early and left late [4 day stay]. for me, i enjoyed getting away from hectic and noisy marriot scene. great location near t...25min to airport costing $2

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel, well situated with good roms and facilities.”
Reviews.Author: Kettles44
Reviews.Content: We stayed just two nights here and we wished it was a little longer. The hotel was really easy to find from the station, just short walk through a pedestrian only park. The aparments were very stylishly done, with pretty much everything you could want. We didn't see much of the staff but when we did they were helpful and polite. It was perhaps a little expensive, but it did have a lot of character and quickly felt like home.

Reviews.Title: “a fantastic place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: ph0ebe48
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while I was at a conference in Boston in September. We have been to Boston before and stayed in privately rented apartments which were OK but this was a cut above the rest by far. We stayed in a one bed apartment on a high floor, the place was spotlessly clean, quiet and spacious. The separate bedroom helped a lot with the jet lag and there was a very well equipped kitchenette with a huge fridge, coffee maker, kettle etc.There was free wifi which helped me stay in touch with work while away. Everything was of a very high standard, very comfy bed, nice linens and a comfortable sitting room. The only slight gripe was the very small bathroom which left little space to put anything down but that was a minor inconvenience. And for anyone wondering as I was there is a hairdryer. There is a continental breakfast available free every morning with bagels, muffins, orange juice, coffee tea and yoghurt which was very handy and saved us having to go out for breakfast every day. Also use of an Apple Mac in the breakfast room which let us print out boarding passes for the trip home. The Inn is very well located right next to the Prudential Centre/Copley Square for eating shopping and a short walk from Newbury St and Boston Common. Boston is a great walking city and this place is in a really good location. It is a sister property of XV Beacon and one thing I would recommend doing is eating at XV Beacon's restaurant Moo which is one of the best steak restaurants I have ever been to. When we ate there they even gave us a ride home (back to the Inn) in the hotel car which was really kind of them-not sure this is standard service. If you are looking for somewhere of a 5 star standard with a 3 star price tag stay here-you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: fly_momFl
Reviews.Content: We booked a one bedroom deluxe suite and it was comfortable for my husband, me, and our teenage son. The Inn offers an air mattress (for a fee) and that worked well for our son. The location was so great! Just around the corner from the Prudential stop on the green line and very close to restaurants, and there is a 7-11 across the street. It really is a quaint building and we felt like it was very private. Though we didn't use it, there is a system to buzz in your guests. Probably one of the most thorough guest service booklets I've ever read. We found the staff very helpful and friendly whenever we called upon them. We didn't use a lot of the amenities as our trip was short and full of other activities. We did utilize the breakfast service as there was a decent assortment of foods. The kitchenette in the room is nicely stocked with cooking utensils, plates.....whatever you might need. My only little quirkiness is that the lighting in the bathroom was insufficient for make up application. Even though there is a lighted magnifying mirror, it was hard. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Summer visit to Boston”
Reviews.Author: James S
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights here in June. The suite was immaculate and well equipped and serviced efficiently. The location was ideal for shopping, restaurants and sight seeing and you soon felt at home in the neighbourhood. The self check-in and out was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Lovely room!”
Reviews.Author: Leahy E
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Inn and found it to be the perfect location. We were one block from the subway (excellent system), the Duck Boat tours and the on-off trolley, as well as being close enough to walk to lots of great restaurants and shopping. Our room was well-decorated and we found the refrigerator very handy. We also liked the keyless system. The only thing that would have improved our stay would be a more substantial continental breakfast--perhaps some cereal choices. We would definitely stay here again and will recommend the Inn to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousEH
Reviews.Content: The location is spectacular. You feel like you are living in the neighborhood and not just visiting. The room was beautiful and the ammenities rivaled any of the five star places we have stayed at in the past. We don't have kids but if you are travelling with a family I could see how this place would be perfect and the small kitchen would be extremely helpful. There is a very small gym that contained a treadmill, bike, elliptical machine and some free weights which we didn't use but we did enjoy the bottled water! We stayed in room 101 and I was a bit worried since we were right by the front door and on the corner but we never heard a peep from anyone or even the street. Our room was lovely and so comfortable. You may wish for a rainy day during your trip just so you can curl up in insanely comfy bed and watch TV in your lovely little oasis called The Inn at St. Botolph.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Inn - Handy Location”
Reviews.Author: Julianne S
Reviews.Content: Although we were only in Boston for 2 nights, this inn was such a great find. Very quiet location, but only a block away from shopping, restaurants and the light rail station. Our suite had a spacious and comfortable lounge and kitchen area which enabled us to spread out and relax at the end of the day. Very close to the Southwest Corridor Path, which is lovely for a stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Great hidden little gem”
Reviews.Author: erk13
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with good amenities in a superb location.... the staff was so helpful, available and accomodated all our requests. Rooms are comfortable, clean and private. Would definitely recommend as an alternative to the chains that cater to the masses. The Inn also provides a wonderful, quick breakfast for those that prefer not to linger in the morning. We look forward to our next stay when visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Boston Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Playfulchica
Reviews.Content: Spent a long, friend's weekend in Boston and we chose The Inn @ St. Botolph because of the location (near restaurants and public transportation) and amenities. The decor is refreshingly current and modern. Each of our rooms had a full kitchen and plenty of room even though the square footage is on the small side. Very well laid out. There is also a small common area which always had refreshments available and a continental breakfast each morning. The unusual thing about this inn is that here is no front desk. There is a person in an office that can handle any issues, questions, or advice you may need, like ordering a taxi, and even tough it was a little different, it actually made it feel as though this was your own home in Boston! I would consider this inn any time I return to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room and location, but room noisy”
Reviews.Author: ejoch
Reviews.Content: The room was exactly what I wanted- basically like having a flat to stay in, with kitchenette, and spacious. very comfortable bed. I always prefer this to staying in a tiny box room at a normal hotel with not even a fridge. The area, Back Bay, is lovely, and St Botolph street is beautiful- you get a nice feeling the minute you look down it. Tree lined and quiet. The downside was, an enormous amount of noise through the ceiling. At times sounded like a herd of elephants was up there, and unfortunately one morning happened at 6am ish onwards, ruining my sleep. I wasn't on the top floor, so clearly was noise from the occupants above. I have no idea, if the floors are really thin, or if it was just bad luck and I got people above who liked leaping about. But if rather put me off spending any time in the room. I should say I'm incredibly sensitive about noise, perhaps someone else wouldn't mind as much.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - thanks!”
Reviews.Author: Trishthefish186338
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night on our touring holiday, but we loved The Inn At St Botolph. We got a complimentary upgrade to an exec 2 room suite, which was great. The place is chic, well eqipped and well located. The Concierge was very helpful indeed and I would highly recommend the place.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was at a good friens home.”
Reviews.Author: Patrick P
Reviews.Content: What a great place, different than a regular hotel, but all the differences where a positive to me. Coded entry sent to you before you arrive, and no worry about your key during your stay. Staff friendly and helpful. No ups no extras, no surprises when you leave, such as phone calls, wok out area,etc. GREAT coffee and adequate snanks gratis in AM. Washer and dryer for your use. Close to everything, but a residential neighborhood. Very comfortable room, bed and linens, and kitchen was a plus. Will never stay anywhere else in Boston, than with my new friends at The Inn at St. Botolph.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: njoytheride
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this place. The location is perfect. One block away from the convention center and cheesecake factory. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. The bed was comfortable, and the service was superb. The staff was friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was excellent. I primarily liked this place because it felt more like a condo/vacation rental where you show up and you have the place to yourself. No need to check in a front desk, or worry about housekeeping. The hotel amenities are available upon request. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Cardon
Reviews.Content: It is very easy to find a more expensive hotel in Boston, but there is no hotel better then The Inn. Rooms are spacious' comfortable, clean, fully equipped like a home. The location is great as you are right by the subway and within walking distance of some of the best restaurants in Boston. WiFi was good and every morning you can avail yourself of the complimentary breakfast with the best espresso you will get anywhere. Stayed here for five days and could live here and be very happy and comfortable. Don't even think about staying anywhere else if you can get a reservation here.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Place.....but starting to show some wear.....”
Reviews.Author: Docktj
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a number of times. This is an absolutely FANTASTIC place to stay: love the concept, the location couldn't be better, and the privacy is unsurpassed. I also love the continental breakfast in the AM and refreshments though-out the day. The manager, Tom, frequently bends over backwards to solve issues that arise (overheard myself): even when the guest's expectations are ridiculous. That said, I noticed on this trip that the physical plant is starting to show a tad bit of wear....from the moderately beaten-up (and dirty keyboard) mac computer in the lounge, to pasteboard boxes stored there as well, to my room needing a bit more attention re cleaning (carpets under the furniture obviously not vaccum-cleaned in a while), to the carpeting in the hall just starting to loosen and buckle, it's obvious to me that it's time for a phased renovation-plan to begin. However, you shouldnt let any of this de-rail a visit. You will enjoy the accomodations: great place!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alluvion
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four, with two very tall teenage boys, and we stayed in a two-bedroom suite. It was huge! There was plenty of space in the living room to sprawl after a day of sightseeing. The kitchen was a bonus, and there is a grocery store nearby. The hotel is very quiet for being in such an urban setting, just a short walk from a T stop. I really liked not being in a sterile corporate hotel. It definitely made our Boston vacation more relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations and then some.”
Reviews.Author: writesabit
Reviews.Content: Business took us to Boston and as usual, I sought accommodations convenient to our meeting site. As it turns out, we were in for a treat. Not only was the inn great in location, it was absolutely one of the nicest we've ever encountered. We travel extensively and this was like being home away from home in the best way possible. For us, the code entry system was a breeze and a delight. For those a little leery of it, there is an intercom and the office is staffed all day. Comforting to know, but non intrusive...nice. Our room was absolutely beautiful. Two large flat screen televisions, plush bed, well equipped kitchen, large shower in the bathroom and a gorgeous turreted living space. Everything was just wonderful and comfortable. A business associate picked us up for dinner one night and he too was blown away by the place. Complimentary breakfast is a huge perk in a large city where dining out three times a day can get pricey quickly. A pro tip: The Nespresso coffee is to die for...really it is incredible. I am jonesing for it as I write this. Convenient to everything in and around Back Bay, Fenway and Copley/Prudential, the neighborhood is living, working and breathing and wonderful to stroll through. Thank you Tom and Michael. Your assistance with our shipping logistics was appreciated as were your recommendations and kindness. All the best and we hope to be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Second time...every bit as good as the first...roll on the third...”
Reviews.Author: straightreviews
Reviews.Content: This place ticks just about every box for us. We stayed here with our toddler son ( inflatable bed provided) and had forgotten just how great it is. The rooms are beautifully furnished and well- equipped with modern, stylish amenities. The plush bathrobes and towels were really welcome after the flight to the US. Breakfast is good quality and more than adequate...quality coffee and bakery products, plus yoghurts and juices. In fact, drinks are available all day, which was a nice touch. Washing and drying facilities and gym good additions and we loved the fact that we didn't have to 'check in', but get a door code to use on arrival instead. Location great...around the corner to the subway, although we walked almost everywhere. Plenty of local good eateries and takeaways, plus two good supermarkets in walking distance. We could live here. And we're really, really fussy!

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Ruffierules
Reviews.Content: What great place. Looked like an upscale apartment that was just renovated by a swanky yet classy decorator. Clean, quiet and the front desk staff were the epitomy of top notch customer service. After staying in various B&B's thorugh out the week, I felt llike I was being rewarded with chic and styllish accomodations. Next time, we will stay with you the entire time . Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Hastypop
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend loved the place. Beautiful rooms, great location, perfect price for it. Just remember to write down the keyless entry code and leave it in your wallet. It's way too long to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, right at the heart of town”
Reviews.Author: A_Benjw
Reviews.Content: I loved this place, and multiple reasons to say that. one block from the metro (which is called T) a few blocks from the commuter rail. very close to one of the biggest mall which hosts good eatries, place to shop and to hang around till midnight. For the hotel, nice and understanding staff, good mannered manager, and complete value for money and i have reasons to say. a) free breakfast b) free every time coffee and water c) free laundry (only thing you pay for is the detergent if you are not carrying one) d) free broadband connection e) free calls to any US mobile and fixed lines To top it all: A mini kitchen with electric burners and a descent oven. Complete Privacy. I would recommend it and probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with unique approach - good for independent travelers”
Reviews.Author: voyageller
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here three times now. The rooms are generally spacious and many features kitchenettes and a small sitting area. This is great if you are on business and working from your room, or on holiday and like being able to make your own tea, coffee, breakfast etc. It doesn't have all the services of the major hotels, but with all the facilities on offer, you don't really need it. The location is quite convenient, just 5 mins walk from Back Bay Station and also close to the Green Line (E).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pretty room”
Reviews.Author: GigiATL
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about trusting the Trip Advisor reviews on this hotel because there were so many written by "one-time reviewers". I am happy to report that we were very pleased with the hotel and especially the location as my husband was in Boston for a conference. The hotel is the perfect location, a very easy and pleasant walk. We loved being right on the edge of a neighborhood. The room was beautifully decorated and it was great having the sitting area and small kitchen. The bed was okay - not the most plush night's sleep but not horrible either. We would definitely stay again and highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good base for extended stay”
Reviews.Author: CanberraTell
Reviews.Content: It's hard to classify. Quirky gives the wrong impression. Different also indicates a negative which it is not. It is St Botolph - comfortable, convenient, spacious and well equipped with nice decoration. The inn was very comfortable with a good kitchenette and in a lovely quiet area just a stone's throw from all the activity. The Back Bay area is perfect with many restaurants and a very good supermarket close by . It is within walking distance of the Symphonyony Hall, the prudential Centre, the Boston Common and the parks of Back Bay. The room was quiet and spacious The breakfast is a basic continental which we "raided" and took back to our room to supplement with fresh fruit. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sunseeker390
Reviews.Content: Overall very pleased with our stay at the Inn. First time in Boston and have to say location was ideal. Amazingly quiet considering how close it is to the Prudential Centre. Train stop nearby got us to all main attractions within 10 minutes. The hotel is clean and comfortable. The keyless entry is easy, but I did miss the personal touch of physically checking in. As such it felt more like renting an apartment rather than staying at a hotel. Room was very well equiped with nice bed and big TV. The fully fitted kitchenette seemed a bit excessive in the room we had as there wasn't really a table (only a small desk) to sit round if you did decide to cook there. But with all the great restaurants in Boston why stay in your room? Breakfast was baqgels and oatmeal, yogurt, juice, etc. in the kitchen downstairs. Good way to meet other guests and chat about where to go and what to see. Only slight irritation was the loud intermittent humming noise from the aircon units on the roof. We were on the top floor and being quite a light sleeper it did disturb me once or twice. I have to say though that overall this hotel was a very good choice and deserves it's high ranking on this website.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: maoflandr
Reviews.Content: Our son and daughter-in-law gave us a gift certificate for the Inn. It was our 2nd stay here and we hope to return in the fall. It is a convenient location and the accomodations are excellent. While we didn't use the kitchenette for actual meals, it is handy to have all the amentities of a small apartment and much more relaxing than the standard hotel room. The keyless entry is handy, but the staff is readily available if you need them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jseaford
Reviews.Content: The Inn is a bit unusual in that rooms are serviced only on a weekly basis. Therefore you make your bed up each day, clean your dishes and hang your towels carefully for drying. Equally, one makes one's own breakfast. Anyone not prepared for this should not stay at the Inn. Otherwise, this is a fantastic hotel -- we had a truly charming room, well-appointed and very comfortable; the locatoin is superb with easy walking distances to all the major sites and/or the the metro. The staff were most attentive, especially Thomas who arranged restaurants for us and gave excellent counsel on sites of interest. We would be most pleased to return to the Inn and woudl recommend it without reservation to persons prepared to act as their own housekeepers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dorsey34
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay tremendously this past weekend. The location was ideal, with restaurants and nightlife within walking distance. The room was very clean and comfortable. We will be coming back on our next weekend excursion to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful room, just a really nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 5gophers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while we both were running in the Boston marathon and had a wonderfully comfortable stay. It is an ideal location to walk and enjoy many sights, restaurants, shopping etc. The room was well equipped and the atmosphere was a really pleasant change from the "cookie-cutter" style of hotel rooms. We both thought the breakfast bar was well stocked and a nice assortment of choices.

Reviews.Title: “What was the hype about?”
Reviews.Author: ourxion
Reviews.Content: Management didn't care, the staff didn't care. I had several problems with my room, all of which were promised to be taken care of, yet ignored. I was really hoping to have a good experience at this lovely hotel like from what I have read in other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sheaf01
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with 7 family members and wanted a memorable stay in Boston. Wouldn't stay anywhere else. Our rooms had efficiency kitchens - the larger room had a full refrigerator and 2 element stove. Rooms are well-appointed, comfortable and roomy. The hotel is 1 short block from the prudential stop on the subway green line - about 4-5 stops from the MFA and the Boston Common (opposite directions). Hotel is about 3 blocks from the Train station and across the street from a large mall with a number of restaurant chains (e.g. cheesecake factory) as well as a Shaw's grocery store. There is a 7-eleven and drycleaners steps from the hotel. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “This was a true find - great neighborhood, and wonderful rooms at a good price!”
Reviews.Author: KatherineK54
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us. The room was wonderful at a great price. We don't need services since we eat out, but the kitchenette was a plus for breakfast and late night snacks. The 7-11 is just at the corner. We went to Boston for one night to visit a few museums and walk the city. The Inn is at a great location in the Back Bay area. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for us, but definitely a choice”
Reviews.Author: kristinehanna
Reviews.Content: The Inn is quite unique. I felt like we received a great deal of value for the room (location, size, amenities ) in lieu of full time staff - to check you in, check you out, offer you breakfast and so on. When you arrive at the Inn, you need to find a parking place (about 1/4 a mile away) and use an access code to buzz yourself in and then locate your room on your on, carrying your luggage. After a long flight, this is not my preferred option, HOWEVER once you get to the room, it is all worth it. The rooms are HUGE, very nicely furnished, comfortable beds, not cookie cutter at all; and you can not beat the perfect location or the low price compared to other comparable lodging in the area. We would definitely stay here again. I just would caution travelers who like and/or require a bit more TLC.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: MandM73
Reviews.Content: It's like you're living in Boston when you stay here! The Inn at St. Botolph is the perfect place to come home to after a day of enjoying the city. Gorgeous apartment-style suites with full-size refrigerators, microwaves, stovetops, amazingly comfortable beds, and awesome shower heads. Though there's no in-house dining room, you can have food delivered from any of the dozens of nearby restaurants. We loved the espresso included in the continental breakfast. The location couldn't be better -- The Inn is adjacent to the best shopping and dining in town on Newbury Street. And the staff is terrific, very friendly and knowledgeable! We will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “We found our place in Boston”
Reviews.Author: bostonmikkel
Reviews.Content: We have been travelling to Boston 6 times per year the past 8 years. We have stayed many different places, but now we will look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Delakotam
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel with restaurant, bar and room service ameneties then this place is not for you. The Inn at St Botulph has spacious, nicely furnished rooms that are really more like serviced apartments. A large fridge freezer, coffee maker, microwave and two-ring electric stove are all supplied for you and a 24hour 7-11 is right across the street. A list of restaurants that will deliver food and wine is also provided. Don't expect your sheets and towels to be changed every day though. Pros: Central, quiet Boston location. Easy walk to subway, a selection of nice restaurants and a small shopping mall. Pleasant and helpful staff. Cons: Some parts of the hotel are starting to show signs of wear and tear.

Reviews.Title: “nice getaway in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: bunny5C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn at St. Boltoph for three nights in July 2010. We were looking for a place with a kitchenette, and also a smaller, more unique hotel. The Inn at St. Boltoph was great. It's not for someone looking for a lot of hands-on service. They do have staff available, but mostly it's a very comfortable, clean place to stay. The decor was very unique and the bed was so comfortable. It's in a neighborhood setting close to public transportation and in easy walking distance to a lot of sights. We appreciated the larger room and high ceilings. The bathroom was on the small side, but otherwise everything was perfect. They have a computer with internet access and also a small lounge area with breakfast and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Wonder”
Reviews.Author: ClassyDudeNYC
Reviews.Content: This place was absolutely incredible, and so convenient as well. The staff were wonderful, polite, informative, knowledgeable, and above all friendly. The room was clean, and felt more like an apartment than a hotel. There was a kitchen!!! I loved that aspect because sometimes I like to cook my food as opposed to go out to an expensive restaurant nearby. This hotel was right of the T which provided easy access anywhere in the city, and was off of a main street which allowed for nice quiet evenings. The beds were unbelievably comfortable, and gave me the best night sleep I've ever had away from my own bed. The only thing I did not like about this hotel was the fact that I had to leave to return to my own home. Wish I could live here!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: fussyoldlady
Reviews.Content: We have stayed for two months for the last two years at the Inn....The rooms are comfortable and the location is just the best...we lived in Boston for 15 years so we know the area well, and the Inn has the best location for us...The staff is always helpful and Tom takes extra good care of us...we will be there again at the end of this year..I like having the ability to fix meals and snacks...that is a help when you are in one location for so long. I souldn't consider staying anywhere else in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “The Inn at St. Botolph was an incrediable experience!”
Reviews.Author: SuzieQ40
Reviews.Content: The Inn's location was great.....it is so neat that it blends in with it's surrounding. The rooms were really large and the bathroom was great. I loved the fireplace was a nice touch. Some of the walls needed some touch up but other then that this Inn is a great value for its price. I did have a chance to use the gym and it was better then any other gym I have used at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great start to our round the world trip”
Reviews.Author: Gemmamcxluskey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the inn for 3 nights from the 1st march and loved it. The room was very modern and stylish and we particularly liked the log fire. It was great to have a separate bedroom and living area and the kitchen was well equipped. The continental breakfast was fantastic with a good selection to choose from, we ate ours in the small lounge area but you could take it back to your room if you wanted. Tom and Michael were outstanding with their advice and help and were very welcoming and attentive. The inn is in a great location just a short walk from newbury st. We stayed in room 100 which is on the lower ground floor

Reviews.Title: “A great choice in Boston”
Reviews.Author: randall63
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we have stayed at the Inn and we love it. It is located in a quiet neighborhood but within walking distance for shopping and great restaurants. The rooms are contemporary in design but cozy. We enjoyed the fireplace and having a kitchenette. Receiving your access code to enter the Inn and your room prior to arriving is unique, no need to check-in or out. We will definitely stay at the Inn next time we visit Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be staying here again”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1121126
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked in around 8 p.m. and as we were getting situated, we saw a huge roach scurry across the room towards the bed. When I called the receptionist for assistance, she was dumbfounded. There were no other rooms available. I called neighboring hotels for availability but their prices were too high. We slept that night hoping the roach wouldn't crawl into our bed. Other issues: you could hear footsteps from the floor above, as well as their TV. The housekeeping showed up late, the towel bar on the bathroom door was broken, and the room generally felt dirty.

Reviews.Title: “a find in Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: pmurray414
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying at The Inn at St. Botolph. The value is incredible. The rooms are clean and well-equipped. You can't beat the location. You should be prepared for the self-service philosophy and there is no parking but for the money, it's worth these minor inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: zgkramer
Reviews.Content: Great location, the rooms were in mint condition with great modern touches. I like how easy it is to get in / out of the rooms. We stayed in a suite and it was big and comfortable. The location in the South End near the Pru, symphony, and the T couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: drduwhop
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend & I found the Inn on-line & thought that the concept & photos of the rooms were quite intriguing....we were in Boston for 2 days & wanted to stay to stay at a warm, inviting & clean establishment...we always stay at inns & B & B's when we travel & the Inn @ St. Boltolph appeared to be just what we were looking for....well, we were so pleasantly surprised when we arrived & were able to see the Inn & our accomodations up close & personal...every facet of the Inn exceeded our expectations...our suite was beautiful, intimate, comfortable & well-appointed....the decor & furnishings were modern & tasteful & the the rooms were sparkling clean!....the "access code" entry to the Inn & room is so unique & very secure....we were totally pleased with our experience & can't wait to get back to Boston so we can stay there once again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: bob1950
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night but everything worked smoothly and the room was excellent. Nice continental breakfast, very close to restaurants, Copley Square, etc.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel offering Kitchenette facilities in superb location”
Reviews.Author: mandjpenny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for Christmas for 5 nights. Our elder son is working in Boston so my wife and I plus aour younger son travelled from UK to visit Boston for the family holiday. We wanted a place with 2 bedrooms , living area and Kitchenette and were delighted with St Botolph. Meant we could be independent and enjoy a family Christmas - the living room had a fire which meant it was very cosy during the blizzard. Breakfast is available downstairs but no restaurant - but that is no problem as the hotel is in a FANTASTIC location next to Prudential centre and many restaurants from cheap to expensive.. If/When we visit Boston again we will definitely stay at St Botolph.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for the Independent Traveler”
Reviews.Author: nealtog
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to Boston for a conference, so I wanted to stay close to the conference hotel (which in this case was the Marriott Copley Place), but I wanted to find a place with free wifi and breakfast, so I searched around on Google Maps and found the Inn @ St. Botolph. Despite being just one or two blocks from Copley Place and right across the street from the Prudential subway station, it was actually cheaper than the conference rate at the Marriott, it came with breakfast and free wifi, and the suite even had a living room and a fully-stocked kitchenette! I was quite impressed. There is no check-in or check-out and there are no hotel keys: a couple of weeks before your stay the staff emails you access codes for the main hotel door and for your room door, and the codes simply start to work at the time of check-in and stop working at the time of check-out. There is a front desk, of course, in case you need something, but it really felt more like I had rented a small apartment for a few days, which is why I say this place is great for the independent traveler. (Room cleanup is on an as-requested basis, but even that is nice since you don't have to worry about leaving things out during the day.) Breakfast was a bit less impressive than I would have liked, since it is fairly basic continental fare, and while we were there they ran out of yogurt and didn't get more for a couple of days. Still, it's nice that they have anything at all, and they do have a fancy coffee-maker that stays operational throughout the day so you can have as much coffee, tea, or hot chocolate as you would like. Overall, I'd say it's a great value, especially for the location, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. (One final note: you won't want to stay here if your plans might change at the last minute, since you pay in full at the time of booking and once you are within 2 weeks of your stay you can't get any refunds.)

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice.”
Reviews.Author: rdmos
Reviews.Content: St. Botolph's is beautiful. We have stayed there once before and love the location and the feel of the contemporary but warm spaces. Great location. We had dinner at Mistral, not to be missed. A little pricey but worth it!!! We had a perfect stay and will go back next year. The no parking is not a big deal. We dropped off our things and drove to the Prudential parking garage. It's 2 minutes away and we got an online coupon which made the parking 25.00 dollars for 24 hours. Easily cheaper than many of the other hotels in the city. They left a bottle of Prosecco in the room which was fun. The bed was not at all the most comfortable bed I've slept in but I am a snob when it comes to beds. Overall I would still recommend the Inn. Can't beat the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Very eclectic and I loved it.”
Reviews.Author: houseelfdobby
Reviews.Content: I stayed for the first time over Thanksgiving for 4 nights. I travel back and forth to Boston quite often and wanted to try something different then my usual hotel. Did some research and found the Inn. Called with a couple of questions and Tom was great on the phone. Loved not having to keep track of keys (just put codes in my blackberry). Had a one bedroom suite and it was perfect for my needs. Breakfast was adequate but coffee was great. Staff available if you need something but not intrusive. Wonderful places to eat, great wine shop within walking distance. Then of course awesome shopping etc right around the other corner! My only disappointment was my room/suite could have been cleaner. Very dusty, bathroom floor and shower needed some attention. Broken lightbulb in lamp and in bedroom one wall lamp was missing and had tape over the wires. Having said this-I did not complain to staff but will be aware next time I stay-which I hope is very soon.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: sreisinger
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at the Inn. I love the comfortable and home like atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect concept in a great location”
Reviews.Author: asboston
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days at The Inn, in the Executive suite. I really love this concept - before your arrival, you receive a keyless entry code - no waste of time at the front desk, no check in/out. The executive suite is a huge 2 bedroom unit, at a very affordable price, with 2 bedrooms, a living room, 3 large flatscreen TVs, kitchenette facilities, a fireplace... Beds were very comfortable, and everything was exceptionally clean, bright and decorated beautifully... Staff is very obliging. It was a terrific residential area of Boston with beautiful brownstones, in a truly pedestrian friendly area where you don't need to use your car. We felt very secure and safe, and enjoyed shopping at the Prudential Centre which was close by. The Boston duck tour (a great thing to do) is around the corner. We had a fantastic meal at the restaurant Mistral near by, and staff was very helpful, giving us touring ideas and dinner recommendations. To make it short, a great stay in a great city. I highly recommend the Inn and will go back there next time I'm in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and charming”
Reviews.Author: guillermoalvarez
Reviews.Content: This place is great! Inside of this inn you feel like you are completely at home. It is small, well decorated, and the lounge downstairs has great espresso! The check-in check-out process was done all online so you don't even have to go to the front desk or anything (but you can ask questions and they are very helpful). I have never stayed at a hotel like this and i loved it. The marriott was $100 more a night and didn't come close to how nice the Inn is:) AND FREE WIFI!!!

Reviews.Title: “Return visit-just as nice as the first”
Reviews.Author: laverty
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a night at the Inn, a second visit after a two year hiatus. I want to report that the hotel is just as nice as I remembered. The room was really attractive and spacious, the bed was super comfy, and the shower is huge. Since this was a quick trip I didn't use the fitness center or the kitchen facilities (though friends of mine had family come through in early fall and said they loved the convenience of cooking meals in the suite) but it was nice to see that everything appeared as clean and fresh as it had two years ago. I needed directions to my destination but didn't have a printer (and no, my phone is not so "smart') so I asked the person on site for help. Not only did he print out the information, he also researched and printed out an alternate route that he thought might be more helpful. Very nice, very considerate. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: elizabethramsay
Reviews.Content: On our recent trip to US we stayed in Boston twice. The second stay was at the inn. We found its location to be so much better than our previous accommodation at The Langham. Had a fantastic lobster meal at the Summer Shack near by, bought cheese and biscuits opposite at the convenience store and wine at a grog shop nearby. We enjoyed shopping at the Prudential Centre which was close by and enjoyed a Boston duck ride from around the corner.Staff were very obliging also.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: jibs4000
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the room under the street. We were very happy with our room. It was very spacious. Kitchen was outfitted with glass, plates and cookware. Bed was comfortable. We enjoyed the ability to control heat. I liked not having a check in desk. Parking at the Prudential was fine. We were only there one night I would have enjoyed staying longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for vacation travelers!”
Reviews.Author: lola1014
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Boston for a weekend get away and this Back Bay location was perfect. We live only about an hour from Boston and visit the city often, but this residential neighborhood with beautiful brownstones was a different choice for us. The hotel or 'inn' had a great mix of modern decor, yet very comfortable/homey feeling. The suite we had was a little small - probably would work very well for a single business traveler - but exceptionally clean, bright and decorated beautifully...especially loved the bathroom mirrors and upholstered pieces. The breakfast was nice but nothing to write home about. The service was very attentive - they answered many questions about the neighborhood - this is truly a pedestrian friendly area and we didn't use the car often.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, quiet, convenient”
Reviews.Author: MKFraser
Reviews.Content: The Inn at St Botolph was great. Location is very convenient and the surrounding neighbourhood is wonderful. In our room we very rarely heard the sounds of the city outside. The little kitchen was handy and we enjoyed the better coffee (better than what was available in room), biscuits, juice and yogurt on offer in the lounge each morning. The rooms were very attractive, well-laid out, clean and comfortable. The only small flaws we noticed were that the walls in the bathroom were in the process of being repaired (plaster on walls, plaster dust on strange rubbery floor), the toilet paper holder was falling off the wall, and they hadn't emptied the kitchen garbage when we arrived. But these were minor things. If you want a full-service hotel, this is not the place for you, but if you are a more independent traveller, it's perfect. As long as their price does not increase, we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificently Delightful!!”
Reviews.Author: Mittamom
Reviews.Content: Oh, my goodness gracious, we cannot wait to come back again.....quaint, comfy, warm, cozy, the Inn of pure pleasure! We were so very disappointed that our travel schedule only allowed for one night. Indeed, we WILL be back to stay longer, to linger, to enjoy what we only got a tiny taste of. We cannot thank you enough for our magnificent stay at your lovely Inn.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bear-On-The-Road
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel experience - i.e. valet parking, restaurant, room service, concierge, bellhop, etc. - this is NOT the place for you. This inn is for people looking for more of a condo experience. You really feel like this is your own little apartment smack in the center of Boston. Here's a summary. ROOMS: My husband, 2 year-old daughter and I stayed in the one-bedroom suite (bedroom closed off from living room). Very modern and sleek. For those with young children, rental baby cots are available (40$ flat rate). It fits snuggly in a corner of the bedroom. The Queen bed is very comfy and there's an angled wall-hung flat-screen TV facing the bed, as well as an iPod docking station. The living room is stylish and comfy with another flat-screen TV over the gas fireplace. Our room had a small kitchen area (fridge, microwave, sink, and stovetop) perfect for having breakfast or fixing a quick lunch. All new utensils and dishes. The bathroom is small but efficient. Shower only, but a large one. Plush robes at your disposal. Amazingly enough, even though you are mere steps away from the Prudential Center, rooms are very quiet because the inn is located on a calm side street. My only small complaint was that it was difficult to balance the air conditioning between the bedroom and living room. When the living room was comfortable, we were freezing in the bedroom. Took more than a few tries to get it right. BREAKFAST: Free of charge. There is a common lounge area downstairs where you can pick up coffee, tea, juice, bagels, yogurt, and English muffins (no plain bread!?). You can eat there, but most people seem to bring everything up to their room. CHECK-IN/OUT: Super easy and efficient. Two weeks before you check-in, you receive two codes by email. One to open the front door and the other to access your room. No keys to carry around or lose! Codes are functional only from check-in time, i.e. 3pm. No front desk, but should you need anything at all, there is an office downstairs manned from 7am to 10pm. PARKING: This is the biggest issue for a lot of people wanting to stay here, but it's really not that complicated. Basically, there is no parking, on-street or otherwise. However, as I said, the Prudential Center is steps away and has a large garage. Boston hotels charge on average 40-45$ a day for parking whereas it will only cost you 25-30$ a day at the Center (25$ is with an easy-to-find online coupon). If it's full, there are many other indoor garages in the same vicinity that offer approximately the same rate. So just temporarily park in front of the inn, unload your car, take it to Prudential Center, and walk back to the inn in 3 minutes. FITNESS: If you need a workout, there's a small fitness center with a couple of machines. No pool. LOCATION: PERFECT!!! In 3 minutes, you can walk to the Prudential Center (conference center, shopping, restaurants, and a subway stop). In 7 minutes on foot, you're on Newbury Street, the main strip for boutiques, restaurants, and cafÃ©s. In roughly 10-12 minutes, you can walk to Copley Square. There's also a neighborhood park for little ones and a plaza with waterworks to cool them off on hot summer days. Finally, there's a 7-Eleven conveniently located right in front of the inn and a supermarket by the Prudential Center. All in all, a wonderful stay in a wonderful city. I highly recommend this inn and will absolutely and gladly return next time I'm in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully modern, conveniently located, and hassle-free!!”
Reviews.Author: galxygrl99
Reviews.Content: When traveling for business, I always try to find independently-owned, smaller, affordable, boutique hotels rather than giving the big corporate, expensive places my money... especially because the bigger corporate hotels always try to nickel-and-dime you for wireless internet, parking, coffee/breakfast, etc... GRRR. I found the Inn at St Botolph online, and the pictures looked gorgeous with their ultra modern design and studio-style living amenities (en suite kitchen with fridge, etc. and lounge furniture). When I discovered that the Inn at St Botolph was located literally across the street from the conference center where my meetings were to be held, I was thrilled. Then, I read that cappuccino, breakfast bars, yogurt, etc. were included, and that wireless internet and Ipod docking stations were available in all rooms. I booked almost immediately. When I arrived in Boston, I found that the Inn at St Botolph actually surpassed my already high expectations! The room was comfy, the bed firm and comfortable, the view from the window lovely, and location excellent... conference colleagues who came over to meet for dinner were amazed at the value for price and remarked that they truly wished they had chosen the Inn at St Botolph instead of a room reserved at the big conference hotel down the street. Not having a main desk wasn't an issue, as the manager on site was super helpful in giving directions, maps, etc. of the city. Also, the keypad entry was hassle-free and easy to use. The only complaint I had was that the door to my room on the 4th floor seemed to be warped in that it wouldn't open/close easily. I had to slam it shut and jerk it open, but other than that, I have nothing but positive things to say about this place! Highly recommend it and would stay again when I come to Boston...

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Accommodations - We felt like we lived there!”
Reviews.Author: zsgnewyork
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed here for a couple of days this Summer during a spontaneous road trip from NYC to Boston. Although it is conveniently/centrally located only one short block from the Prudential Center and subway stop, it is on a quiet street. Our one-bedroom suite accommodation was spacious enough and very nicely furnished (gas f/p, lg flat screen TV, etc.). The fully equipped kitchen was a big plus - allowing us to warm up for breakfast the delicious leftovers from dinner out the night before! You don't get the large hotel services - which we didn't need; we preferred these accommodations since it was more akin to a condo and we felt more like natives and less like tourists! The amenities are on a rather small scale, but sufficient. The lounge housed a large screen TV; complimentary beverages (really good coffee), cereals, cereal bars, bagels, cream cheese, etc. and a large mac computer with printer (i.e., "the business center"). The fitness center was also small (only a few pieces of equipment), but was sufficient so I could run a few miles on the treadmill. There are also complimentary bottles of ice cold spring water in its small refrigerator. Since we made the reservations last minute (same day!), we got a significantly discounted rate (about $180/night). At this price, I would definitely recommend it since the comparable "conventional" hotel alternatives we found were > $250/night. BTW, we love Boston!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: 22Peripatetic
Reviews.Content: The rooms are comfortably furnished and there are flat-screen TVs in living room and bedrooms with access to far more cable channels than most hotels provide. I stayed in the 2-bedroom, one bath flat. One bedroom was a large double; the second was a bit small, but fine for one adult or a couple of kids. There was good closet space, plenty of hangars and an iron and board. The bath I had was modern and there were lots of towels, though not enough bars to hang wet towels on. The neighborhood is safe, convenient to public transportation, and within walking distance of the MFA and Gardiner museums. The Inn is located a short walk from the Back Bay Amtrak station and is convenient to a Whole Foods market, should you wish to cook in the well-equipped kitchen. The staff is well-informed and always helpful. Continental breakfast is free in the communal lounge.

Reviews.Title: “loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: pamshore
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying in the inn while we were delivering our son to college in Boston. It was such a lovely place! It was impeccably clean and very stylish! The staff were quite helpful and the lounge welcomed us every morning with a lovely stock of breakfast items. The location is perfect... no car needed, which is great because parking is so expensive!! We already have our reservation here for October and I am thrilled to be staying here again! I have only one suggestion... more towel hooks to hang and reuse wet towels please! I want to be "green", but find it difficult to do so with so few towel hooks!! Otherwise, the perfect stay! Pam from Atlanta

Reviews.Title: “It's like a hidden treasure in downtown Boston!”
Reviews.Author: jgbaum24
Reviews.Content: Skeptical at first, we were surprised by and taken to another level of comfort during our stay at the Inn. Our suite roomy and furnished just like home - almost like it, just better! Trendy,but warm and welcome as we easily forgot that we were actually staying in an Inn in downtown Boston. St. Botolph's Inn gives the name "Inn" a new meaning.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: wadsworth2
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said, the hotel's location cannot be beat as it is within walking distance of most Boston sites and is in a great residential area. Our one bedroom suite was better set-up for a solo traveler than a couple as seating and moving around were a bit odd. The staff were very helpful but ran out of food for breakfast one of the days we were there. The keyless entry, etc. was a plus as far as we were concerned. Would probably go back again considering other options in the area. Fitness center and free computer/phone calls were a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, very impersonal, pricey for what it is. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: littlericky34
Reviews.Content: This place was very clean, and the rooms were set up nice. The rubber floor in the bath and kitchen were weird and industrial looking. It is not a warm cozy place. It felt like all business. The furnishings are modern and cold. I know some people like that, if that is your style. The parking is offsite and adds $39 a day to your stay - really not acceptable for a place that is charging well over $200 a night. The keyless, human-less arrival and departure is really not welcoming at all. If you want to covertly go to Boston and speak to no one, go here. The front desk guys were nice enough, but we asked for a walking tour map, and they had none. We were referred to the Prudential Center, which is 2 blocks away, and huge. I ended up buying a map app for my ipod. The breakfast was adequate, the coffee machine in the breakfast room was way too complicated, though there was a coffee maker in the room. The TV was also confusing, though the desk guy was very helpful with that. In all, it was clean, but cold.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EandF_Kelley
Reviews.Content: Loved how close the inn was to the Prudential Center subway. Neighborhood atmosphere. Large room and bathroom. Stayed in Studio Suite. Only con was we could here people upstairs walking, talking, etc. Great view onto street. Breakfast was a light, typical continental... coffee, bagels, cup of oatmeal. Staff was very friendly and helpful. If we come back to Boston we will definitely consider staying here again... Just on the top floor,

Reviews.Title: “Home for a night”
Reviews.Author: GDP_222
Reviews.Content: I live about 45 minutes outside of Boston and my husband and I commute in for work. We were in town one Sunday and spent the night at the night at The Inn at St Botolph. The no check-in is great. The room was nice and homey. We both had short walks to work in the Back Bay Monday morning. The Inn is situated in a South End neighborhood so it does not feel like a hotel. It felt like we had our own place in Boston for the night. This is a great place for extended stay business travelers who want to feel like they have a place to go home to at night.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Zazzblammymatazz
Reviews.Content: Great place - just across the street from the Prudential center. No check in; email confirmation and access codes get you right to your room. Nice decor, very modern. Flat screen TV in room, has a fridge and small kitchenette.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, Private, Intimate, Friendly"”
Reviews.Author: AirwayWarrior
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure, everything was perfect. I want to say dont stay here, so that there will always be a room for me. We got in early, contacted the office and since the room was available were allowed early access. When we checked out, storing bags for the day was no problem. Office staff were friendly and knowledgeable about the area. Great service, they are available when you need them. but otherwise you are left alone. I would stay here again and again, either on a long term assignment, or another getaway weekend. Bedroom and living space were excellent, a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “A seriously excellent surprise for a business traveller”
Reviews.Author: LindaPKentucky
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent - Back Bay on a remarkably quiet street just a short block from plenty of access to transportation, restaurants, shops. (There is a large hotel on the main street so cabs are easy to find.) The room was generous, beautifully decorated, comfortable, great work space with good lighting, reliable free WiFi, and a very well supplied kitchen area. The bathroom is on the small side but well designed. I travel about 20 days a month; this place was like a retreat but right in the middle of the city. This is a great value in Boston. The design is unique so be sure you know understand how the inn operates - self check-in and -out with key code access. The staff are there if you need them and very helpful. When I am back in Boston, I don't think I will look anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Love the atmosphere and the location...”
Reviews.Author: Liponel
Reviews.Content: This inn is perfectly located in Boston Bac bay areay. It offers beautifull room, very nicely decorated. Wireless is free. Very good expresso. We just loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Inn, good price, decent location”
Reviews.Author: TheMcGs07
Reviews.Content: Great staff, excellently maintained property, good for short or extended stays becuase of the in room ammenities. If you're traveling a lot to downtown I would recommend learning the subway as cabs cost about $10 plus tip to get to downtown. Great place with an exceptionally friendly staff...

Reviews.Title: “Our best travel surprise ever!”
Reviews.Author: JNABAker
Reviews.Content: We chose this inn from several we found on the internet, based primarily on the location and advertised price. We could not have been more pleased with the location, amenities, cleanliness, accessibility -- a terrific value for price. We would definitely stay here again. The only problem with giving it five stars across the board is that I'm worried it will be hard to get in once the word gets out! Our travel companions agreed it was the perfect place to stay for the Fourth of July week-end.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I lived in this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jaqhaq
Reviews.Content: This is by far the nicest, cleanest most comfortable hotel I have ever stayed in. Very quiet and quaint, but luxurious in details. Sits in a terrifc part of Boston, close to major attractions, but a couple of blocks off the main drag so very quiet. This hotel caters to travelers who want peace and quiet, and discretion. The access code entry is wonderful, makes it very easy to get in and out without dealing with waiting on lines to check in. The rooms are very clean and comfortable and I slept like a baby. The staff was very professional and responsive - but if you dont need them you dont have to see them! wonderful wonderful wonderful . well worth the price, would go back again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent indeed!”
Reviews.Author: bostonmikkel
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Boston, so I know what areas I like to live in. South End is my favourite, and the Inn @ St. Botolph is perfectly located, within walking distance from the Prudential, Newbury and Tremont. The key-less system is brilliant. I never had to worry or re-check anything when leaving my room. The staff is super friendly and helpful, and the rooms are beautiful and equipped with everything I needed. The complimentary breakfast is adequate and the coffee is good. I'll recommend this place in a heartbeat, and I am happy that I have finally found the place for me to stay whenever I am in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: purple_jellyfish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn for 3 nights, the last stop in our 2.5 week family road trip. Hands down, the best accommodation! We never wanted to leave the apartment - that's how good it was. Spacious enough for our family of 5 - grandma, mom, dad, 2 kids. The kitchenette is small, probably suffice to heat up food and simple meals, but the three HUGE HD TVs were a real treat! The living room is very large, and the sofa plush enough to sleep on. You can tell they have put a lot of thought and pride in the furnishings and decor - everything was new and lush. We stayed on the top floor and one of the bedrooms was in the turret, which was quite special. You are given your own code for the main door and your room, so there's a lot of privacy. Now, the location - couldn't have asked for better - literally just behind the Prudential Centre. We will definitely be back to the Inn if we are lucky enough to visit Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful new hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: DRM_10
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed staying here. The location is perfect. We were pleasantly surprised to see that it's a fairly short walk from Back Bay station through a lovely public garden. The system of entering with a personal code worked well, and the fact that there's no check-in desk made it feel like we were staying in an apartment building. It also made the place much quieter than other hotels. We're glad that we reserved a suite--which was very comfortable. The staff was very nice and helpful. Wish we had a reason to return to Boston, so we could stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for my honeymoon - awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: DB805SB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently decided to get married on the spur of the moment instead of waiting for over a year as would be necessary to plan the perfect wedding. We planned everything in about 10 days. Once we had set the date, I went about finding a hotel room for us to stay at on our special night. I spent hours looking at various hotels (both small and large) hoping to find the "perfect" place. After almost giving up on the idea, I stumbled upon the Inn at St Butolph St. I was immediately excited about the prospect of staying there, it was a small (16 room) hotel, which I preferred, it was in a great location (right in between the back bay and the south end, all the rooms were suites, and the deal sealer for me was that they had keypad access to both the hotel front door and the rooms themselves - meaning no checking in, you simply type in your code (emailed to you in advance) and presto - your in!! This is very cool in my opinion. The room was very nicely decorated, with a full kitchen (including flutes for the champaigne we planned on drinking), a desk, couch, seperate bedroom, and a huge flat screen tv with literally hundreds of channels to choose from. The only thing to go wrong about my stay was that somehow I must have made a mistake when booking the room, and ended up booking it for the night before our wedding instead of the night of - doh!! As soon as I realized my mistake (on the morning of my wedding no less) I called the Inn and begged them to give me a room for the actual night we needed it. The were most understanding, and my wife and I ended up getting another room at no cost for our honeymoon!! I can't thank them enough for their willingness to work with me on this issue, as a second nights stay was certainly not in our last minute wedding budget. All in all, we had a great stay, dined at Legal Seafood (in the near by Prudential Center), strolled down Bolyston and Newbury Streets, stopping for some window shopping, ice cream, and yes, more champaigne!! I would highly recomend the Inn for anyone looking for a quiet, unique, romantic weekend away in one of the best locations in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - would return”
Reviews.Author: intowntraveller
Reviews.Content: Had a great one night stay with my daughter. The spaciousness of our Deluxe One bedroom suite was fantastic. It was more like a small apartment than a hotel room. We didn't have any issues with the fact that there isn't a front desk. We also didn't have any issues finding parking. When we checked in, it was before six so there was plenty of parking right in front of the hotel (residential parking spots that can't be used after six). We stayed on a Saturday night so after we went to a show (blue man group) and dinner and came back we got a meter spot on Huntington Ave. which didn't need to be fed and were good to go as there is no meter fee on Sundays.
