Went for dim sum in chinatown on Sunday morning which was fun. The continental breakfast was fine. The girl on duty had no idea how to operate the steamed milk feature on the cappuccino machine. Would have really liked a cup on cappuccino, but nonetheless the regular coffee this machine produced was delicious. One negative was that our room was not supplied with truffles as we were told it would be. My daughter (only 8 years old) was sort of looking forward to that. The girl in the continental breakfast area said they were out of stock. Oh well. All in all a great stay and I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and quiet modern luxury...”
Reviews.Author: CaitC17
Reviews.Content: Even though my boyfriend and I live in the greater Boston area, we wanted to celebrate his birthday in style in the city. I always try to choose boutique hotels as they have greater personality than the average hotel, and the Inn delivered. The location can't be beaten, nestled on a quiet street in Back Bay and a short walk to all of the South End restaurants. The room was beautiful and stylish, obviously designed by someone with a good eye for quality and character, satisfying my boyfriend's modern taste and my desire for something slightly eclectic and funky. The only flaws I found were that the fridge in our suite's kitchen hummed quite loudly all night, and the bed seemed to have been frequented more often by single guests, so that there was a noticeable dip in the middle that made each of us feel we were on a slant (somewhat trivial, I realize). We didn't partake in the breakfast offered in the lounge because there wasn't much on hand aside from coffee and bagels, but we had a delicious breakfast a short distance away on Newbury Street. Overall, it would be silly to pass on an opportunity to stay in this place. Given the cost of other hotels in the Back Bay area, and the personal feel the Inn offers, adults visiting for business or pleasure would be equally content, I believe.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeAndColleen
Reviews.Content: It looks like this boutique hotel was converted from a Brownstone on a residential street one block from the Prudential building. The setup is really great; there's no front desk per-se; you are given pass-codes for the front door and your room a couple of days beforehand, so you can come and go without dealing with anyone if you wish. There is an office downstairs and there's someone there that can help you out if necessary. The staff was very nice and attentive. Our room was a great size; similar to a studio apartment with a full kitchen. We had the smallest size room so I can only imagine the size of the larger rooms. It was a great location with plenty of shopping, eating, subway, and taxi access very nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: conniw
Reviews.Content: The Inn at St. Botolph is a home away from home, with all the luxuries included. The rooms are well appointed and you'll have everything you need. I like the suite where the bedroom is in it's own room and there is a living room and a small kitchen. Ask for the room with a chaise longue and you'll be able to fit another person in the room with you. In the morning the Inn serves a light breakfast where you can make yourself an expresso, eat fruit, cereal and fruit. You can also use your kitchen to make food. The Inn is centrally located so you can walk to anywhere in the back bay area or hop the T to wherever you want to go. There is no parking with the inn. If you take a car ask the manager where the best place to park is.

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Experience”
Reviews.Author: smetzger
Reviews.Content: Toured the property and had dinner with the hotel manager and it was a delightful experience. I have been in the travel business since 1975 and have an eye on knowing what to look for in a hotel. My inspection exceeded my expectations! The hotel is spotless, well maintained and has a courteous and professional staff. Having dinner with the hotel manager was a bonus as he's an exception individual that believes in providing the best in customer service to his guests and willingly goes the extra mile. Overall I was quite pleased at how well this property operates and is managed. I have no qualms in recommending a stay at The Inn at St. Botolph

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay but”
Reviews.Author: Broadswordfighter
Reviews.Content: First of all let me say the the Inn is a very nice place. It is clean and the staff are very friendly. The rooms are very nice though there is a significant lack of storage space in the room my wife and I stayed in. Now for the but. Calling the Inn at St Botolph is a misrepresentation of the highest order. Nutri-grain bars, bagels, and a fancy espresso machine do not a B&B make. Not having enough coffee in the room does not help improve the situation either. Instant coffee really doesn't cut the mustard. the Inn is located in a great neighborhood and is very centrally located but it is not worth the rather hefty price tag that is associatted with it. Another complaint is the lack of attention to detail regarding the upkeep of the Inn. Again for the monies paid there should never be lights out in the common area, ever!. During my stay i counted no less then 15 lights out between the floor i stayed on 3 and the elevator, the first floor, and the ground floor. Just not acceptable for the price. The bedroom doors in my suite did not close prperly and were missing hardware. Again a lack of attention to detail. As they say the devil is in the details.

Reviews.Title: “the best place to stay in boston!”
Reviews.Author: ptmather374
Reviews.Content: great location...spacious suites...very private..enjoyed my stay immensely!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, Excellent location and very modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGirl11
Reviews.Content: I searched high and low for just the right place to celebrate my birthday weekend in Boston and the Inn was just perfect! The location was amazing- one block from the shopping center that hosts ton of great shops and restaurants and a short walk to Newberry Street. The staff that works at the Inn were exceptionally nice and very accommodating! We rented two rooms, the suite on the 4th floor and the one room that is below ground (room 100). Both rooms were very modern and clean. The only downside to the room was the second bedroom had small curved ceiling (good for a kids room and sky lights - due to the weather it proved to be very loud with the rain but the other bedroom in the suite was great! Our flat screen tv's did not work our entire 4 day stay but didn't bother me. The room below ground was extremely quite and perfect for a good nights rest. The Inn is set up like an apartment as apposed to a full service hotel which was a huge plus in my book! All of us who stayed loved the place and the over-all experience we got. I can say we would ALL go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: hotpink929
Reviews.Content: The Inn At St. Botolph was nothing less than exceptional, and in a great location to explore the city as it is right around the corner from the Prudential Center. Upon our early arrival we were still able to check in, and if for some reason the room wasn't ready they were more than helpful to store our bags for us. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Inn at St. Botolph was different from other Inns I have stayed in as you check yourself in with the given code upon reserving your room. This was a very different process from what we are used to, but worked out very well and the staff was still available if needed. I could tell that this staff pays very close attention to detail, and the room was exceptionally clean as well. The bed was 'oh-so-comfy' and the high quality robes hanging in the room were a very nice touch to put on after showering. All the furniture and accessories in the room are top of the line, but the hotel did not seem pretentious in any way. As previously mentioned, the Inn is right around the corner from the Prudential Center, and was very convenient to accomplish many different types of activities we had planned. I would definitely recommend the Inn At St. Botolph to others, and would stay there again for any other Boston trips in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, compact, quiet, very well-placed, a home from home”
Reviews.Author: Tory_tourist
Reviews.Content: My first trip to the USA; I picked this 16 room Inn from the TripAdvisor recommendations, and I was not disappointed. The only problem I had was parking the rental car, but the Prudential building one block away (2 minutes) had plenty of safe parking at $39 per day. Very close to the 'T' station on the green line, and in the Back Bay area - walkable to Copley Square and as far as Boston Common. The Prudential building had good shopping malls with numerous restaurants; there is a 7 Eleven store opposite the hotel and Shaw's is 5 minutes away. With the studio room having its own kitchenette (fridge/freezer, microwave, coffee maker, toaster oven, two ring electric hob and even a waste disposer), one could have cooked if one wanted - and great for snacks etc. A basic breakfast is available downstairs in the small lounge from 7 to 11am, with a large-screen Apple for internet access; hot coffee, cold juice & yogurt, toasted muffins and bagels set you up for the day. Tom the manager couldn't have been more helpful and friendly - his staff are on duty until 10pm in the office, and available later by telephone. One (small) minus - the hotel opened in the fall of 2008 after a major refit, but is an characterful 'brownstone' building with wood floors; it's a matter of showing consideration for the other HOUSE guests, for that is what we were - the room is serviced when required, but will be left for up to 8 days if not required - perfect for that late sleep-in after traveling! Air conditioning kept us warm, but fresh air was also good in the quiet neighborhood. A first-class experience of US hospitality and a 'boutique' hotel! Thanks, Tom; you made our stay great. We'll be back real soon!

Reviews.Title: “An unique experience”
Reviews.Author: newtravelerinusa
Reviews.Content: My friend told me about the Inn @St. Botolph and recomended us to stay there when I went to Boston. The place is beautiful, the service is first quality and the fireplace was just right. The location is superb because even if it's located in one of the busiest areas in Boston ( Back Bay), the St. Botolph St. is calm and pretty with all the brick stone houses. Walking distance for two malls, bars, restaurants, everything!!!!!I am writing this review because I think the place deserves this comment but I would rather to shut my mouth to keep the place as a hidden secret!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: hfllamas
Reviews.Content: The suite we had was perfect for our needs and a great location. Would definitely return. Only thing missing were the advertised chocolate truffles which were not available...

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable Inn, very mixed experience with staff”
Reviews.Author: TnT_Surf
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Inn @ St. Botolph during a trip to Boston on Presidentâ€™s Day weekend. We found the location and amenities convenient. The interior of this boutique hotel is tastefully decorated and gave us a great sense of privacy. We made mixed experiences with the front desk staff, however. At one extreme, we found Dolores to be exceptionally helpful, competent and charming. She provided us with a wealth of valuable information about the city and the neighborhood, and was very effective at troubleshooting. At the other end of the spectrum, we were highly disappointed in the behavior of Tom, who was, on two occasions, surprisingly rude, condescending and showed zero introspection when confronted with such feedback. Unfortunately, the hotel business is a peopleâ€™s business and such encounters ruin the experience of what would otherwise be a gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Boston's Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: TheRabbit75
Reviews.Content: I was looking for peace and quiet in the city and a place to take my very pregnant wife were we could find an escape with all the comforts of home. The Inn At St. Botolph provided everything and more that we were looking for. Located in Back Bay this Inn is unassuming in that it blends in to it's surroundings among Boston's beautiful brownstones. It's unique style of "check in" is a wonderful alternative to the usual front desk service of most hotels and inns. The rooms are on par with some of Boston's most luxurious hotels and if you need anything there is somebody available to take your call with a push of the button. The Inn's rooms have luxurious furnishings, a fireplace, full kitchen with all of the accessories, and a glorious bed that will make you want to never leave the room. Boston is typically a walking city and The Inn's location is within walking distance to most everything the city has to offer. My wife and I loved the idea that we could just as easily prepare a meal for ourselves right there in our suites kitchen or travel to one of the many wonderful restaurants in the immediate area. You are also surrounded by lots of conveniences as the Inn is close to many of Boston's largest shopping centers. I have traveled extensively for business and I wish every city had an Inn like this. For extended stays this is like having an apartment in the city waiting for your arrival. No crowded lobbies, no complex maze of a hotel to get around. The Inn At St. Botolph simply and magnificently provides a home away from home (albeit an upscale home) for the weary road traveler. I can't say enough about this wonderful property. Whether traveling for leisure or business this Inn is a rare find and a must stay for anyone visiting the Boston area.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the city”
Reviews.Author: ssppe
Reviews.Content: This place is a find! Relatively inexpensive, great location, spacious and well-appointed. While they have minimized the extras-they have not overlooked any important details. Frette linens and robes? YES Fully outfitted kitchen? YES Fitness room and lounge? YES Well-designed, comfortable spaces? YES! Overall a great hotel, especially if you are staying a while. It would be a 5 star review except parking is a few blocks a way, and that can be a bummer when youre lugging multiple bags.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Comfort”
Reviews.Author: MagyarNC
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel! This is a Brownstone in the historic Back Bay area that was converted into a hotel. It is very hip and modern. The inn reminded my husband and I of a wonderful edgy place in London, called base2stay. The hotel is located one block from the Prudential Center and the â€œTâ€� (Bostonâ€™s metro). All the booking for the hotel is done over the Internet. Once you pay, they email you an entry code for the keypad to their front door. This made us feel more secure as it limited who can get in to the building. You are also emailed an access code to enter your room. It is a lot like your front door code thus remembering both numbers was not hard. The keypads is a great idea as we did not have to schlep keys with us around Boston nor fumble for a key to get in to our room. We can see this 21st Century lock becoming more common at inns. The Inn at St. Botolph definitely lives up to its namesake, the patron saint of travelers. It should be ranked even higher than it is in TripAdvisor. The rooms are spacious and tastefully decorated. A small kitchen is included with the room. There is a two-burner glass top stove, a full size refrigerator, lots of glasses (including some for Champagne and for other wines), utensils, and a kitchen sink. The bed was heavenly with its very soft and warm blanket made by Berkshire Blankets (We plan to buy some of these Massachusetts blankets for our beds soon!). The lighting is not the typical hotel room lighting. It made the room feel homey. Photos that you see online really represent how nice the rooms are. There is free access to their wireless Internet. And if you haven't brought a laptop, there is an iMac in the basement lounge which you can also use free of charge. We did that to avoid the higher nasty airline luggage fees you pay at the airport. Due to the keypad entry to the inn, there is no need for a front desk. But1 That doesnâ€™t mean you canâ€™t get face-to-face service. The office desk folks were very friendly and helpful. They even steered us to one of their sister restaurants which ended up being an excellent recommendation (see our review of Teatro). The Continental Breakfast provided is light, but there is enough to eat to have you satisfied until lunchtime. Parking warning: Boston only allows residents to park on the street in the city. There are metered spots out front, but they are only for residents after 6:00pm every day. This means Sunday through Saturday. Boston parking lots can run $40.00 per day without reentry (meaning you have to pay every time you exit the garage). We highly recommend hopping on to the â€œTâ€� or a city bus. A cab is a better alternative to driving and parking a car in Boston. When looking for a place to stay in Boston for a convention or meeting, skip the Boston Marriott Copley and the Sheraton Boston Hotel, and have a wonderful time at The Inn At St Botolph.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: dm1223c
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Inn over New Year's Eve weekend with my husband based on the recommendation of my sister who lives on the same block..I wasn't sure what to expect but I can tell you we felt as those we had our own apartment in Boston and we loved it..The living room w/fireplace was great, we were able to stock our fridge.The bed was heavenly..We are planning a return in the summer and hope to spend a week and I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else..Location is fantastic and even though room service is always nice, the breakfast items downstairs were great..We really enjoyed it and told everyone..On the way home, we read the review in the NY Times and I felt they were a bit harsh..The water pressue definitely could improve but if that is the only thing I could be negative on...Look forward to our return.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware of their cancellation policy!”
Reviews.Author: DMM7
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before and very much like the location and rooms, and the rates are very competitive. I do have a big bone to pick with their cancellation policy: I booked the room 10 days ago and attempted to cancel five days before our stay due to my husband being stuck on a work trip with a cancelled flight. I discovered you CANNOT cancel within a 14 day window (even though I booked within this window as well) and they will NOT give you credit for a stay another time, either. So, this means I have to eat my entire night's stay with no recourse. So- word to the wise if you think there is any chance your trip might change- this is not your best option.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, Superb location, Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: blueiii
Reviews.Content: I called St. Botolph's at the last minute and got a great rate to stay for my three night business trip to Boston. I had a one bedroom suite on the lower level (room 100) and was very happy with the entire experience. The kitchen was nicely appointed and veyr handy, especially considering that a Shaw's grocery store is a short walk away. The furnishings are sized to the small rooms, but are comfortable. The lighting is all adjustable and not the typical hotel room lighting. The fireplace pilot light was not lit when I arrived but it was fixed quickly after that and it operated without problems during my entire visit. The hotel offers wonderful privacy without sacrificing service. The breakfast provided is light, but with a kitchen of your own it really doesn't present a problem. The location is convenient to the Shaws, and the T-station, not to mention a 7-11 right across the street. I will definitely stay there again when I travel to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great stay .... but it rained!”
Reviews.Author: CFM5
Reviews.Content: I would thoroughly recommend a stay at The InN and thought it was a great location, a super facilty and excellent value for money. My one problem was, it rained, in fact it rained a lot ... and the pump to pump out the water from the basement ran right under my room! Please try and damp down the sound!

Reviews.Title: “Very charming retreat in a great location”
Reviews.Author: superiugi
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a very pleasant surprise. Lots of charm combined with modern amenities. The room (suite) was cozy and comfortable, with a fully equipped kitchenette. The staff was friendly and helpful. We loved the location - quiet and convenient to stores, restaurants, public transportation and the convention center. We will certainly try to stay at the hotel again on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & innovative!”
Reviews.Author: Livvy-Dennis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in the beginning of October and thought this hotel was a pure delight. Just the thing you need en want when you are in the big city! 2 weeks before you arrive you receive an entrance-code by e-mail, when using this both the front door and room door opens. No checking-in, you walk straight to your room, strange, but something we both appreciated. The room was beautiful, very large bed, hugh flat screen, nice bathroom and even a kitchen (we didn't use that but still it was nice). In the morning you go to a small sort of kitchen where there is the best coffee (nespresso) available, with some cakes, fruit bars, yoghurt and brownees, nice sitting area, again another enormous flat screen, after that: off you go, the city is waiting! The inn is located very centrally, 3 minute walk to the T, several shopping centers nearby, go to Top of the Hub for a nice drink with gorgeous view, again a 10 minute walk max. Very safe area. We would de finately stay here again when we visit Boston and already recommended it to several of our friends and family. I wish every big city in the US had a place like this!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: luca33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at saint botolph inn for 5 nights and for us thereÂ´s only one word to describe .....perfection!

Reviews.Title: “9/10”
Reviews.Author: richardc77
Reviews.Content: Great place, great staff, seriously good rooms. If i was being really really picky i would say the rooms didn;t have the best soundproofing in the world, but tha'ts about it really and it represents good value in a very good position to stay (back bay). Have to say the added free wifi access and truffles was a nice inclusion too, too many charge for wifi these days, suspect that will change soon though...

Reviews.Title: “Cozy elegant place in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: sharpcookie
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days at St Botolph's, enjoying it very much. My husband attended a conference at Copley Place, which was 3 minutes from the hotel, and there was also plenty to do for me and our 1-year old daughter. Playgrounds and parks, shopping malls, restaurants, Boston's landmarks - all within a walking distance. We loved the accommodation, it was very convenient to have your own kitchenette, a separate living room, a big TV - especially if you are with a little one and have to cook for her and entertain her ;) Breakfast lounge - also a big plus, with great coffee, bagels, muffins and whatnot. The guys in the office were super friendly and eager to help. Even on a cold and rainy day we were glad because we could quickly get to Copley Place with all shops and restaurants to keep us busy. All in all, this hotel was a wonderful alternative to regular huge chain hotels, both in terms of convenience and price. And it was so much better to spend these days in Boston in an apartment in a nice old house instead of characterless hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Homely Suite Hotel in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: BamHI2009
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in a one room suite for 3 days and loved it. This hotel is warm and cozy with friendly staff there to help with anything you might need. It also has a lovely homely feeling, you only get room service if you request it. This might bother some but I prefer to be able to leave everything in a mess to deal with myself and only get room service when I need new towels etc. It's located on a lovely tree lined street in the heart of Boston, but just around the corner from a large shopping Mall and a short walk to the tube and rail station of Boston Back Bay. We took the train from there all the way to New York (4h trip). One thing I particularly liked about this hotel was the free access to services which other hotels would add expenses to your bill for - for example there is a free breakfast downstairs in the lounge every morning, free access to wireless and if you haven't brought your laptop with you there is an iMac in the lounge which you can also use free of charge. I also liked the fact that you only need an access code to get into your room - so no need to take cards/keys with you all the time. It's also quite a contemporary hotel by American standards which European customers might prefer. My only complaint would be the lack of a bath in the small bathroom - I'm not sure if every room is like this but ours was. All in all, a lovely, relaxing all inclusive hotel which I would throughly recommend for someone traveling to Boston for any circumstance.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a perfect location !”
Reviews.Author: DoloresG
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, friendly staff really made our stay at this beautifully refurbished town house in Boston. Extremely comfortable, elegant surroundings in a great location. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Samuelunique
Reviews.Content: Very very nice, but since soming home I see their prices have gone way down from what we paid. I think it might be worthwhile trying to negotiate, nevertheless, the location and quality is first class.

Reviews.Title: “Loved apartment and location - shame about the noise”
Reviews.Author: otter19
Reviews.Content: So wanted to give this place 5 stars. Good stuff Location was fantastic, apartment was clean, comfortable and well equipped. Excellent TV and free wifi. Excellent shower. Loved being able to pick up take out and make drinks etc. Bed was comfortable with quality linens but the pillows were awful. As we were staying for 2 weeks went a bought a pillow for $4 from Sears which solved the problem. Liked having the "on-demand" maid service and keyless system for getting in. Bad stuff Lack of soundproofing - you can hear everything in the adjoining rooms (thank you to the woman who was making her son practice the flute every night til 11pm) and if you have a noisy neighbour forget it. Our first weekend the people on the top floor decided to have a party. We literally could not hear the TV in our apartment. Phoned the office at 9pm to ask them to turn it down a bit. Noise increased. Phoned again at 9:30 - office staff said they had phoned but got no response - that's because they can't hear the phone over the freakin noise! Whoever was on the desk was most put out that we suggested they go to the apartment and speak to them. Still no reduction in noise - the office staff suggestion - if they are still noisy at midnight go up and speak to them yourselves! Not the level of service I expected for $289+tax a night. If you are sensitive to noise do not stay here - we bought earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “I felt like I was coming home every time I arrived at the Inn.”
Reviews.Author: bostontraveler19
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable. The kitchen is very complete. I wish I had stayed longer so I could take advantage of it. Perfect location and extremely quiet and safe at night. I would absolutely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very different. Nice to have privacy and yet a helpful staff in the office.”
Reviews.Author: miaRhodeIsland
Reviews.Content: Felt like I was going to my own condo. I wish I brought more food so I could have stayed and cooked my dinner instead of going out. Really love the concept and enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Easy, Elegant, and Chic!!!”
Reviews.Author: interpretingstudent
Reviews.Content: I have traveled many places and stayed in many hotels throughout my life. Even the London Savoy pales in comparison to this place! The rates are more than reasonable for the accoutrements that The Inn offers. I am a people person, so it was nice to briefly interact with the staff. If you had any questions, they were very quick and knowledgeable in order to best serve whatever needs we had. However, if you do not want to interact with people, this place is great! There is no standard check in procedure. You just go to your room, and it's ready! This was a fantastic experience, and felt more like I was going home as opposed to back to a hotel. Michael, Dante, and Tom were all very cordial and polite, helping us with everything we needed. Mostly my questions were what were great places to eat in the area, and they were very knowledgeable. One night, me and my boyfriend were hungry, and wanted cheap, yet delicious Chinese food. Michael helped us out, recommending a delicious place that delivered. It was unbelievably simple! We didn't have to leave our suite unless we wanted to! The comfort that the suites provide are beyond luxurious. Beautiful canopy beds, with modern chic decorations throughout made this place very enjoyable. You are staying in a very old brownstone building, but you would never know it! Everything is modern and beautiful! Never once do you feel like you are staying in a stuffy hotel. I had the best night's sleep every night staying here. The beds are firm, yet comfortable. Also, I could watch their huge HDTV right from my bed! A DVD player was available, which Michael brought right to the room within minutes! The continental breakfast that this place serves is standard. Their coffee is quite delicious though! And the coffee machine is UNBELIEVABLY cool. I have never seen something like it! I can't describe it, you would have to try it yourself. The Inn served bagels, muffins, fruits, yogurt, juice, coffee. Typical from what you would get at a continental breakfast. However, it is hard to understand why one would want to eat a continental breakfast when there are so many delicious restaurants around! Michael recommended us to Thornton's which was right on the corner. They had the most delicious food I could imagine! It was the cutest little cafe! I had the most enjoyable of visits here during my stay. Again, everybody on the staff is incredibly lovely, and really worked hard to make our stay enjoyable. I have recommended this place to everybody I know when they come to Boston. This place was more than practically perfect in every way, it is absolutely superb in every way imaginable! I can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place to stay in great location.”
Reviews.Author: squarz
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this place, more freedom than a hotel as own kitchens, even had a list of takeaway restaurants ideal with a 1 year old child.Also you could help yourself to breakfast in the lounge downstairs. Even though everything is self service there are staff incase of problems which is all you need. Hope people stay and enjoy it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GlosTim65
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 301 (deluxe 1 bedroom suite). The room was spacious, clean and well equiped, and great value for money). We loved the check-in system (key pad coded for both main entrance, and room), and the privacy that it gave us. We also enjoyed the extensive channel options on both of the TV's. The hotel is on a quiet street, yet only 100 yards from the Prudential Centre and the T. Also, for sports fans, a short walk to Fenway.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous rooms and location can't be beat with impeccable service!”
Reviews.Author: Mom058
Reviews.Content: Tom and Michael were both very helpful everytime we had a question or need. Rooms were even better than we had pictured. Lots of room. Location is a block from subway which made everything easily accessible. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique/apartment hotel hybrid perfect for the independent traveller”
Reviews.Author: SW19Traveller
Reviews.Content: I think I might have almost found perfection! I have often complained at least to myself that whenever I stay in hotels in US cities, they are bland with unnecessary frills and no character. The Inn @ St Botolph addresses these gripes splendidly by combining the best features of boutique hotels and apartment hotels. I loved the fact that there is no reception desk, no lobby, no doorman to tip and no souvenir shop. You come and go as you please using a set of codes e-mailed just before your arrival. If you do need assistance, the guys in the office downstairs are very helpful and similarly if you do need your room made up, you just need to leave a note out the night before. The room itself is very stylishly decorated with plenty of space in the one bedroom studio, a very comfortable chaise-longue, doors to close off the sleeping area, a decent shower room with watering can-style shower and a very handy kitchenette with vast fridge. We were able to save a huge amount on eating out in the evening by buying food from the nearby Whole Food Markets and keeping it in the fridge. The whole place blended style and function very well indeed. We were very satisfied. The hotel's location is also very good: convenient for the Newbury St. shops in Backbay, about 30 minutes' walk to downtown Boston and also well located for the T system (although we walked or cycled everywhere). There is also a convenient Hertz car rental in the nearby Sheraton hotel. St. Botolph St. itself is delightful with a great period feel to it. Breakfast is provided in the lounge downstairs although it is probably easier to eat it in your room. We thought it was perfectly adequate with fresh bagels, muffins, fruit, juice and coffee. Overall it fitted our needs perfectly and I would thoroughly recommend the place for any reasonably self-sufficient leisure or business traveller. The internet access by the way was excellent. If I had one tiny tiny niggle, it would be that the beds have sheets rather than duvets. If it had duvets, this place truly would be an utterly perfect base for exploring Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iz789456
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic hotel. Great location. About 2 minutes walk from the T stop at the Prudential. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Decor throughout the hotel is beautiful. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We will definitely stay there again the next time we're in Boston and will definitely and have already recommended it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “What a Delight!”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid001
Reviews.Content: After a long leisurely day of exploring winding roads through the New England mountains and then sluicing the final stretch into Boston for the night with no reservations, we were dismayed at the lack of availability and costliness of accommodation as night fell. What a relief it was to find a friendly reception from the staff at The Inn @ St. Botolph - and what a delight! The accommodations were were not "just" luxurious and tasteful , but cutting edge chic apartments. This boutique hotel is a true treasure set on a residential boulevard in a red brick former manse, a stone's throw from the heart of Boston and all its attractions. It was a discovery beyond our expectations - a gem worth re-visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended Place to Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: julesmakes7
Reviews.Content: I attended a business convention in Boston and brought my family with me. With 7 children and my wife, we needed a large space or two hotel rooms. The hotels in Boston are pretty expensive, and getting two rooms would have been astronomical. My wife found The Inn at St. Botolph on the internet and it was perfect. We got a 2 bedroom, 1 bath apartment and were extremely comfortable. The boys slept in the den on the sectional sofa, and the girls slept in one of the bedrooms with the trundle bed. We were told it was a queen bed with trundle, but it turned out to be only a twin with trundle. We brought along an inflatable mattress and made up the difference with that. The building was extremely quiet, and has been recently renovated. The decor is very nice and everything smells clean and new. There were 3 large flatscreen tvs in the apartment, but the Direct TV programing was very limited. Not a problem though since we were so busy seeing the sights in Boston that we had very little time to watch tv. The small kitchen had a full size fridge, microwave, and toaster. It also had a 2-burner stove, 4-cup coffee maker and was furnished with dishes and cookware. We did not use the stove, but we did use everything else. If you have a large family or group and need 2+ bedrooms and prefer to have everyone together, the Inn at St. Botolph is perfect!! It is one block from the Prudential Center, which is a mall with all sorts of shops and also the "T" is located underneath. There is a T entrance on the same side of the busy street as the Inn so you won't have to cross the street to get there. I also highly recommend the T as the quickest and easiest form of transportation around Boston. It will take you anywhere you want to go, and is easy to use. The quiet neighborhood where the Inn is located was a nice alternative to the busy sections of town where the hotels are situated. Although I did not take advantage of it, the Inn offers an exercise room and lounge in the bottom floor. There is also a computer if you need to use it. One of the nicest aspects of the Inn was that they e-mailed you an access code for the front door and your room so you did not have to deal with check-in procedures like regular hotels.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing luxury for our budget!”
Reviews.Author: TheLoversRaLa
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel for the price and the location. We went for our 2nd wedding anniversary and it was great. The room was very nice and the amenities great. We stayed about 4 days and the kitchenette came in handy---We splurged on one of our meals and went to Mistral--My husband was then able to have RACK OF LAMB for breakfast the next morning thanks to the microwave. The breakfast is not regal, but we ate out for both lunch and dinner so it balanced out. The muffins are easily brought back to the room and toasted in the toaster oven (there's also butter if you like). They put no limit on how much you take from the breakfast area, so I was able to take couple extra juices and granola bars for snacks. There is also fruit and yogurt. The money saved on breakfast was well worth it. Also, the fireplace was very romantic and the decor was definitely photo worthy. We felt as if we were living in the lap of luxury. We are young and have no desire for anyone to carry our luggage or anything else. The "abbreviated" services model never hindered a thing--we had an issue with turning on our fireplace and a nice gentlemen who works the desk came up and fixed it (it needed a switch turned). We were able to ask all the questions we wanted of the desk and they were always prompt with returning e-mails before our visit when I had questions. Honestly, if every hotel in America went "abbreviated" I can't say I would see it as much of a loss, since I'm either in my room, or out and about and can't say I need anything substantive in between. The maid service was also excellent. Oh, and I loved the drapes! One small issue, the lamps above the bed...are stylish but relatively unnecessary. My husband was hastily moving one and it actually hit him in the lip--not pleasant. Otherwise, the storage space in the room is amazing. I read one review that said their were no drawers, etc to speak of. My room had 2 closets and 2 dressers. (I stayed in a 1 bedroom suite). I even made nice use of the little decorative bowls to hold my jewelry and keys.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: SuttonTraveller28
Reviews.Content: There were many excellent things about this hotel. Location: We were in Boston for a two night stop from New York and so the proximity to Back Bay Rail Station was helpful - as it wasn't far to drag our cases! The subway is very close indeed as is the Prudential Centre. The 7-11 is opposite the hotel (doesn't sell alcohol however). The street is quiet and respectable. We didn't have a car - but as their website says, there isn't parking (all seems to be resident permit parking). I would really check this out if you are driving. We walked into the centre every time - but this does take a little time. Subway would be a matter of minutes. Check in: Before we left the UK we had not received our entry codes. Apparently this was a problem with Expedia not supplying them with our e-mail address - but they could have telephoned us I suppose. Nevertheless, once we called them, they were very helpful and the codes were sent through straight away. Personally I like this this system. I think most modern travellers loath having to 'hand in the room key' and 'return by a certain time'. The elimination of keys and interaction with reception staff was most welcome and made our stay that little bit less formal. Staff: Staff were helpful throughout. We left our cases with them before check in (and again after we left our room) and they were most obliging. When there was a problem with the air conditioning, they arrived straight away. Can't fault the friendliness. Room: We were thrilled with the room. Having your own kitchenette (with a decent fridge / freezer / ice maker) was tremendous. The decor is very trendy indeed and works extremely well. All curtains / bedding etc are high end and high quality. Made for two excellent evenings after we returned from various restaurants. Can see that the free internet and US calls would appeal to some. The TV choice was excellent. Their welcome guide was comprehensive - but would be good to recommend some restaurants to which they are not affiliated (thought I understand why they don't). My one minor disappointment was the water pressure in the shower. The cubicle was massive - but the shower lacked any real punch. This said, I have found that in other US hotels. I have ummed and ahhed about giving it 5* as there was one thing I wasn't hugely happy with. Our bed backed onto the lift shaft and this could be quite noisy (and unpredictable - depends when someone uses the lift!). During the day and evening this didn't matter - but in the middle of the night I found that it woke me up. I would think very hard about accepting Room 103 again. That said, I am not saying that I woudn't, because the benefits of this hotel were enormous. I didn't use the gymn - so can't comment on this. Breakfast was a nice touch - but needs to be a little more imaginative. If you like a more modern experience in very stylish surroundings, then this is for you. Despite the issue of the lift noise we had a superb time and I hope to return. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint neighborhood hotel that feels like a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: lorikris
Reviews.Content: This place is so great. My husband and I stayed there for our recent trip to Boston for vacation. It is in a quaint residential neighborhood that is within walking distance to everything. There is a 7-11 at the corner, the subway is literally barely a block down the street, Prudential Mall is around the corner, a grocery store about 0.5 mile away (if that) and awesome restaurants galore. The street was quiet and tree-lined. We lived in Little Italy in downtown Chicago during our college years and it was like being at home only better. Apparently this used to be an apartment building, so you have a code to get in, or else folks have to be buzzed in, so you feel very safe. The room was cozy with a little kitchen with everything you could think of or need. There is Direct TV in the room too. The bed could have been a little softer and it was quite a chore intially to get the tv working (there are even instructions in the room, which made us concerned that this must be an ordeal if there are actual instructions, how hard is it to work a tv?), but after we figured it out, it was fine. Breakfast is lame (bananas, Sara Lee muffins, granola bars, coffee and juices), but with all there is to see and do around there, it was hardly an issue. Overall this place was so quaint/no frills and like a home away from home without all the hustle-bustle of a giant hotel, we would definitely recommend it, and we will be staying there again, when back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, almost perfect Inn”
Reviews.Author: GrouchyBear
Reviews.Content: This is nice, cozy hotel tucked away in a charming neighborhood in Back Bay. It is ideally located near museums, restaurants and shopping but away from much of the hustle and bustle. It's a place where you never have to see any staff - you are issued a code to the hotel door and you're room door. There is not daily maid service, just touch up service when requested. The room I had was decorated beautifully and well-appointed. They need to add hangers with clips to the closet, otherwise, they have thought through almost everything. The bed was extra firm, the towels soft and large, and the bath products excellent. Good cable TV with many premium channels, and free wireless internet. Within a few blocks an array of amazing eateries. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Don't change a thing - exactly what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: Familyoffour19608
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for only one night in the middle of a week's vacation in Maine. The difference from our austere accommodations in Maine to the Inn was most shocking. We used the Inn because of its proximity to Berklee. We could not have gotten a better deal. Everybody was comfortable and recharged. It was a perfect place to base our school visit. Your staff was pleasant and everything about the rooms was just right. We hope to come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: RushfanMI
Reviews.Content: When we travel for fun, we like to explore the town at our own pace. Our hotel room acts as a home base, so we're looking for comfort, and trying to avoid hassle at all costs. The Inn at St Botolph was perfect for us. Not having to check in or out saved us time coming and going. The room was very nice, equal to any other luxury hotel I've stayed at. We especially appreciated having a real fridge, freezer, and microwave. I had never been to Boston for pleasure before, and I was amazed at just how good the Inn's location was. It's a quiet brownstone neighborhood, not noisy or overly busy, but yet it's exactly one block away from Prudential Center. That meant nothing to me when I made the reservation, but it turns out to mean subway access, restaurants, and shopping. I gave the Inn a four for service, not because there was anything unsatisfactory about our stay, but because it simply didn't feel quite right to give a perfect score for service to a hotel where I had absolutely zero contact with the staff. Our entire stay was fine without any visible presence from the hotel staff at all. That's unique in my experience, and I liked it a lot. If we make it back to Boston, we'll be back to the Inn at St Botolph.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: chuBcn
Reviews.Content: We came to the Inn St Botolph by chance (because of an overbooking). All was perfect, much better than we had expected! The room is so cozy, very well decorated.. and the system of non check-in and not check-out works cool! It is a great idea! It makes you feel like home! Besides, It is placed in a very well-comunicated neighbourhood (the T), and you have all the facilites that you desire near.. Prudential Center is 3 min on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great amenities”
Reviews.Author: Euan_Barr
Reviews.Content: The Inn @ St Botolph is a perfect place to explore Boston from. The hotel is ideally placed, just 2 minutes from a metro stop, and you can be downtown in 15-20 minutes. Our room was well sized, very recently redecorated, and with all the modern features you'd expect from a high end hotel like HD TV, IPOD Dock and Broadband Wireless Internet. My only gripe was the that some of the bathroom fittings had started to come away from the wall, but it's a tiny point The addition of a kitchenette is perfect if you want to make a light meal yourself or get breakfast without leaving the room. There's a supermarket just a couple of blocks away for shopping if you need it or a 7-11 across the road for essentials. The breakfast they offer is pretty reasonable; coffee, fruit, granola, juice, but it's all pre-packaged and you make it yourself. If you want more you can always make it in your room. They gym is a nice touch as well with a couple of new machines including IPOD interfaces, and some weights so you can work off those massive meals! We had a few problems on checkout day picking up our hire car and the guys on reception were more than helpful, letting my wife use the phone and office even after we'd checked out to sort everything out. Maybe it's a little pricey, but you get what you pay for and this place is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TRVLNIS4US
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our 10th wedding anniversary in Boston and stayed at the Inn ~ we couldn't have asked for a better location. The Inn is close to the subway (known as the T), the Prudential Center, shopping, dining and even 7-11. The room we stayed in at the Inn was a one bedroom with kitchenette. Included in the room was an iron, ironing board, coffee maker, refrigerator, stove top, microwave, safe and 42" TV. We loved the keyless entry into the main building and our room. Even though breakfast items were offered we chose to walk around the corner for a cooked to order breakfast that was reasonably priced at Thornton's. For those wanting to get out of Boston for a day or two, you can rent a vehicle right at the Prudential Center (Enterprise) ~ great priced at $45/day. Drop is is 24/7 so don't worry about parking in Boston ~ just return the car when finished with it. We are returning to Boston in October 2009 and will stay at the Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: btown36
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The location is perfect, the nearest T stop is only a couple blocks away and there is an abundance of restaurants and shopping in the area. If you're interested in taking the trolley tour, the nearest stop is only a 5-minute walk from the inn. Even though they don't provide housekeeping for stays less than 7 days, you can request one if you want it. All in all a very good experience and we'll definitely return there the next time we visit Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect..”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Manchester
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Inn for 4 nights in the middle of June and was very impressed. Very large rooms, good value and a great location. I think Boston in general is a very safe and pleasant city to walk around and around St Botolph is no different. No hassle checking in or out as they simply e-mail you with your key entry passcode and you type it in when you arrive. However there were always staff on hand in the basement to help out of needed. Would definitley stay here again if I returned to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “You have to stay @ the INN”
Reviews.Author: jomochicago
Reviews.Content: wow... what a concept, keyless entry works like a charm. Come and go when you please, absolutey gorgeous rooms, huge suites with kitchens, state of the art flat screen tv's, full kitchen. Unbelievable. The even provided an air bed for our child.... Stay was fantastic.. We loved the Inn... Highly recommend it. Location, location... walk to everything

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Charming and Wonderful place to stay - Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Seidner2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in town for a Red Sox game - we found that Fenway Park was very close and conveniently located to our Inn. The Inn At St Botolph exceeded our expectations by far - - and then some. Check-in was a breeze. VERY clean and VERY nicely decorated inside. Highly recommend The Inn At St Botolph to anyone looking for a charming and cozy place to stay while in Boston. Upon arrival, the guys at the check-in desk provided us with a great easy to read map of the area - this made walking around checking things out very easy. Great place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonAlbany
Reviews.Content: Other than the great location (the promixmity to the Prudential Center), I am really impressed by the decor. Staff is friendly and helpful. I'd like to see a bit more varieties offered for breakfast - perhaps some yoghurt? I also found the refrigerator very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique style on tree-lined Back Bay street.”
Reviews.Author: XREES
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night but wish I could've stayed longer. This is half way between a boutique hotel and a serviced apartment. No restaurant, no bar and no fancy (but ultimately unnecessary) lobby. So, with all those costs saved, they can afford to knock a massive slice off the room prices without denting the quality. I've paid twice as much to stay in a room this well designed and kitted out. Fantastic quality room with a great view onto the leafy street. Funky and beautifully designed furniture - plus a massive flat screen TV. And a great big fridge in the ajoining kitchenette (I took a studio room). Fab. Staff extremely polite and accomodating. Will defintely return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely getaway for a special celebration.”
Reviews.Author: midwestgirl_56
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on internet information for an anniversary trip to Boston--I was looking for a unique place for a special few days and we were not disappointed. It is very intimate and distinctive--so close to the downtown sites, but yet situated in a quiet residential area. The young men at the desk were very helpful, the location excellent, kitchen fully equipped, bathroom small but high end in many ways. Our main complaint was that the furniture in the living area, while tasteful in looks, was not comfortable to sit or lay on. Thankfully the large flat screen was visible from the bed, where we spent most of our time while in the room. The fitness center was small, but the equipment was high end and easy to use. Would definitely consider St. Botolphs for another trip!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and good deal”
Reviews.Author: was49
Reviews.Content: We liked our room and the pillows were not as bad as some other reviewers have indicated. It says something about the hotel when the worst thing i can think of is the hard pillows. We really liked the lack of check in and invisible staff but found out they are around if you really need help. We have relatives in Boston and plan on staying at St. Botolph again.

Reviews.Title: “The Inn at St. Botolph is a hidden gem.”
Reviews.Author: bengaltropicat
Reviews.Content: In the Back Bay and a stones throw from the Prudential building is one of those places that your best friend tells you about. The Inn at St. Botolphs is new, stylishly furnished- including an ipod player and DVD player upon request at no extra charge- and a staff that made us feel truly welcome. Wifi with good signal was also included. We did some serious walking and it was great to kick off the shoes and relax in our studio room with wine and snacks and a movie in the evening. The studio included a micowave, full sized refrigerator and stove top if you are inclined to be more ambitious than we are about cooking. We had great meals in some of Boston's finest but we also made stops at local street markets and Shaw's (just down the street) for movie food, breakfast and snacks in the room. There is a continental type breakfast included, too. If you need to print something, a computer with printer is provided for guest use. Beds are comfortable, linens lovely. The Inn at St. Botolph is convenient to the T and because it is around the corner from several large hotels, cabs are easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AdminAsstMarketing
Reviews.Content: I was there over Mother's Day week on business. So the Inn was a great choice. The location was ideal to the convention center, 5 minutes tops. Grocery store down the street and 7-Eleven right across the street. It was a one bedroom apartment w/extra perks. I took advantage of all the services. Free phone calls, use of the computer (free Wi-Fi), breakfast (when I didnâ€™t feel like cooking), washer/dryer, workout room (when I wasnâ€™t exhausted from work, shopping or site seeing). The staff was super. I met each one every day while I was checking my emails. My laptop took a dive the second night so I was in luck that they had one to use. The bed was comfy and the pillows were great after a long hard day. TV in both rooms was convenient, the safe in the room was a great addition. Since the Inn was keyless it made getting in so much easier and safer. My only set back was no tub for soaking my tired body, but the shower head made up for some of it. I am planning another trip and I will be coming back. I also book for others and will use this Inn again and again. GREAT PLACEâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings but location could not be beat”
Reviews.Author: markobmf
Reviews.Content: When I saw this inn had opened I was excited. I was a former resident of Boston and recognized this place as being nothing short of perfect in terms of it's proximity to all the sights, shopping and restaurants in the back bay. The minimal staffing is fine for me since I really am a low maintenance guest and would rather not pay for the "pampering" in city locations. The room was nicely decorated and comfortable but the television never worked. We brought this to the attention of the management who could not fix it so I ended up just telling them to forget it since we don't watch tv at home so saw little need here at the inn. A big problem I had with the room was that the bathroom was exceedingly cold. There was no forced hot air supply in there. I understand construction limitations in retrofits but a towel warmer or radiant electric in the floor would have made it bearable. I always consider the price I pay when rating lodgings so when it's a cost effective stay my expectations are lower. I probably would have given the place five stars had the bathroom not been freezing. I may have forgiven the TV since the manager did offer to have the cable guy come fix it. I would only stay here outside the winter months or in a room with a heated bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: MadRusski
Reviews.Content: Overall, a top notch experience. Location was excellent (I was attending a conference at the nearby Hynes Convention Center). Plenty of nearby restaurant choices. Mall one block away for any shopping needs. Subway station about 100 yards away. 7-11 across the street. Room feels brand new, fresh and tastefully decorated. Everything worked as advertised. Staff were very helpful with any requests. Nice treadmill, "stairmaster" and stationary cycle and dumbells in clean workout room. Decent free espresso machine in lounge. Would definitely stay here again when I come back to Boston. Excellent value in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: tamay
Reviews.Content: My staff used the Inn for a business gathering and it was great! We all had our own rooms (gorgeous!) and held our meeting in one of the big suites. The manager Michael treated us all like old friends, not just customers. We wanted for nothing! I loved the keyless entry and "self check-in" because it meant you could come and go as you pleased without having the staff in your face all the time, I felt like I had my own apartment in Boston. The location can't be beat, I was worried about figuring out the subway system, but I never even had to try because you could walk to everything! I will definitely be back! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location!”
Reviews.Author: runJuJu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Boston Marathon and the location was perfect! Loved the decor, flat screen t.v. and location. Don't expect a lot on the breakfast, but having a kitchenette made up for providing for yourself. Lots of restaurants and shopping close by.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Boston Marathon!!!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth339
Reviews.Content: My husband and I truly enjoyed staying at the Inn. I was there to run the Boston Marathon and the location was so close to the finish line!! We were also so close to great shopping and restaurants. The rooms were very clean and very comfortable. The service was top notch. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The apartment you wish was yours”
Reviews.Author: roundtheblock
Reviews.Content: Just like a modern downtown apartment in a big city. I have friends who despite their best attempts have not managed to pick such nice finishings and furniture. Staying here for weeks would be a pleasure. They understand technology like no other hotel. My laptop and cell phone both had no problems connecting to the free WiFi. Keyless and person-less entry makes coming and going private and quick. This place is sophisticated and individual. It was strange at first not seeing anybody or being told how to get to your room, but the process is much quicker than having somebody direct you to your room. I like staying in hotels that put you among the residents so you can get a feel for the place and this location is literally among residents in the South Corridor area. No parking but if you call they'll give you plenty of options. Don't forget the coffee downstairs, it tastes pretty good!

Reviews.Title: “great location, great service, wonderful people!”
Reviews.Author: JWEBERS
Reviews.Content: We had the chance to be in Boston for the Boston Marathon, and to catch up with family and friends. Someone else made our reservations for us, and we are so glad they did! Thanks to all that we came in contact with; you made our stay very special with your personal touches!

Reviews.Title: “Part hotel, part apartment -- a unique place!”
Reviews.Author: SkyeTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hats off to this developer (who also did XV Beacon) for coming up with this concept. It's midway between a hotel and a rental apartment -- and a LOT more stylish than most hotels or apartments in Boston. As most reviewers have pointed out, you quickly feel like a local. I had a top floor suite and loved the generous windows looking out over St. Botolph Street. In fact, since I was in Boston looking for a property to buy, I immediately added this neighborhood to my wish list -- it was that nice! The kitchenette was well stocked with dishes and cutlery. You probably couldn't cook a three-course meal in it, but it's more than adequate for making breakfast or eating a take-out meal. The bathroom was fairly tight, but since it was new, I didn't mind. There's free wi-fi, and it worked well. And all phone calls within the U.S. are free on your room phone, which I've never seen anywhere else. My flight out of Boston didn't leave until 9:30 pm. I was able to arrange for a 7 p.m. checkout for a very reasonable charge, although I had to move to a basement room since "my" room was no longer available. The office is open until 10 pm, and the staff is very helpful. The lounge is located in the basement, which to be honest, isn't all that inviting because it's dark. But you can use their Nespresso machine to make delicious coffee. I know Boston well, and this inn is unique in the city. If you've ever wondered what it feels like to live in a lovely neighborhood in Boston -- stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Sooo much better than a chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: everafter
Reviews.Content: I stayed a couple of nights at the Inn recently and the quality of the hotel made every aspect of my visit better. It felt more like I was staying "at my place in Boston" rather than at a hotel. After a long day of travel there was no tedious check in process. I simply entered my suite. Stepping inside, I felt like I was walking into a personal space; not a cookie cutter hotel room. In regular hotel rooms I often find myself spending all my time on the bed - eating, watching TV, working on my laptop, talking on the phone all on the bed. At the "my place in Boston" I spread out and "lived" in the entire space. Used my laptop (and high speed internet) at the desk; ate in the kitchen; watched TV on the sofa in the living room; and used the bed to sleep! All the comforts of home but with a great view of Boston out the window. I loved the location. Shops, restaurants and transportation all right there and in a very comfortable, walkable neighborhood. If you stay more than a day you'll feel like a local. Overall: high quality, super clean, spacious, great location. All the best aspects of a hotel and an apartment rolled into one. Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: unavailable
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else has been saying, this hotel is great. My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon last month. Everything about the hotel suited our needs perfectly. It was like having our own apartment in the heart of the city for the week. The location can't be beat. We barely needed to take public transportation since there was so much within walking distance. The best part about the location is that even though it's right in the heart of the city, it's tucked away in a little residential section so the street noise is minimal. We actually felt like we were being too loud when walking home late at night and speaking at a conversational level! The location can't be beat and neither can the hotel itself. The old, stone exterior is beautiful and blends beautifully in the historic, Boston landscape. The interior is top notch with it's modern conveniences starting from the front door to the bedroom. Not having to check-in at a front desk really makes you feel like you're staying in your own place. You can come in and go straight to your room as soon as you arrive. I say "room" but it's more like an apartment with your own bedroom, kitchen, living room, etc. Anyway, I could continue praising this place, but I'd just be repeating what others have already said. If you're going to Boston or just need a few nights away from home, why stay anywhere else than here? It's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Updated rooms and very clean”
Reviews.Author: lltCharleston_Sc
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a two night stay in Boston at this lovely inn which was perfectly located for our purposes. We were looking at colleges with our son. The schools were all within walking distance or easy to get to on the T. We had a suite with a fireplace, kitchen, and a separate bedroom. It was so comfortable for the three of us. The rooms were updated with very contemporary furnishings and a lot of attention to detail. Also, the rooms were spotless, including the bathroom. There was a gym downstairs, the staff was very friendly and helpful, and the breakfast that was included had healthy choices and great coffee. This place is terrific.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: Foxx0
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I took a trip to Boston and stayed at The Inn for 5 nights - I can not say enough good things about the stay. We stayed in a suite which was fabulous! It was like home away from home -the decor was exquisite, the amenities are top-notch, the hospitality-amazing! The location is ideal for everyone and everything- so lovely- I would never stay anywhere else and will recommend The Inn to anyone I know that is traveling to Boston for a stay. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Boston's Best”
Reviews.Author: jimbo52
Reviews.Content: If you are planing a trip to Boston this is the place to stay.My wife and I stayed here March 13-15 .We have stayed at alot of highend hotels on our travels and the Inn at St.Botolph tops the list.You can not beat the location.Everything you need is right out the front door from the T-stop to places to eat .The staff is great,they go out of there way to make your stay great.This is truly a first class place all the way.When we come back to Boston this is where we will stay.Thank you Inn at St.Botolph for a wonderful weekend my wife and I will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel, but remember to . . .”
Reviews.Author: PickyGuy
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel and it's also an excellent value. This is a different kind of hotel. They don't have a typical front desk. Upon booking this hotel, they will send you a confirmation email. You should record the pass codes contained in that email. if you forget then you will have to use the intercom at the front door to call the hotel office located in the lower level of the building. If they're taking an office break then you might not get in! There are no room keys - you must enter a six digit code to get in. We booked the 2 bedroom suite. Each room had a flat screen TV. The wireless internet worked great (and this wireless pass code is also in the confirming email). The entire suite was well decorated and everything was first class. The complimentary breakfast was spartan, however, they have this super cool lazy man automatic espresso/latte machine that produced excellent coffee. I didn't use the work out room but it looked nice. Staff was friendly and helpful. Location was attractive. Not far from downtown. As the other reviewers have said, there is functionally no parking near the hotel, but then I assume that many will be taking a cab around Boston. Whenever I return, I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Growing Pains, But I'd Come Back”
Reviews.Author: weji13
Reviews.Content: Here to visit son at college ... Beautifully decorated, somewhat high tech, comfortable... Not your grandmother's hotel, however -send Granny elsewhere. The positives are the overall appearance and location. Comfortable bed, latest technology (wifi, HDTV, electronic keypad entry system both to Inn and room, hi-tech exercise room, upscale plumbing fixtures in kitchenette and bath... Negatives (not too serious for me) are (1) bathroom vanity had no light... -ceiling light was low and not adequate for makeup, hair, or shaving; (2) no chest or drawer space in room (none!), so, relative to personal items, you need to live out of your suitcase; (3) strong "new building" odor might drive sensitive noses nuts; (4) there is a jacuzzi in room 102 (yum!) but it's not hooked up (oh well...); (5) all of the pillows are jumbo and quite firm -would prefer some options here... But none of these things would prevent me from returning. I like the "non-chain" hotel thing, hi-tech is my life, and the St Botolph staff seems to want to keep their guests happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great option if you are staying longer in Boston”
Reviews.Author: paradaCologne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Inn@St Botolph for two and a half weeks before changed to its sister Hotel 'XV Beacon' for 2 nights (read my review at the XV Beacon). At the moment you arrive, you feel like being at home. My room was a 1 BDR Deluxe suite which quite big and has a seperate living room and a kitchenette which is a plus. A huge Fridge and a toaster, Microwave. 2 Flat HD TVs with over 100 channels! Check its directory for some informations like tours, delivery service etc. There is a Lounge at the G Floor where you can have a light breakfast and a little but very efficient Mac Computer for free internet. You can also use a W-lan for FREE anytime and as long as you wish in your room. The network was very good. The Housekeeping came everyday to clean up the room, they even washed the dishes I've used ! The location is very good. If you like to be around the good shopping spot then stay here! Newbury street and Boylston street are just steps away. Copley plaza, the Pru are within 5 minutes walk. Amazing. Red Sox fans? The Fenway park is about 6 mins car drive or 15-20 mins walk. 7/11 just opposite the Inn which makes life comfortable. Ryan, the Inn manager was very helpful as well as the other staff there. So if you are going to Boston longer than 1 week, this is gonna be your right choice. Thank you guys for a great accommodation. Esther from Germany

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Boingercat
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at The Inn at St. Botolph. Overall, it was a great experience. We booked a 1-bedroom suite (kitchenette, living room, bedroom, bathroom), and it was an adequate size for ourselves and our 6-year old son. There was plenty of closet storage as well. The many windows made it bright during the day, but the room-darkening curtains made it sufficiently dark for sleeping. The staff were consistently polite and helpful, and were immediately responsive to any of our needs. They even called us back when we tried to call them but got no answer--even though we didn't leave a message! Our room was very quiet, and we couldn't hear the elevator, which was right next to our room. The location couldn't be better (5-10 minutes to everything), and overnight parking was only 1-1/2 blocks away, at the Prudential Center parking garage. There are a few things to take into consideration if you're planning to stay as a family with younger children at the Inn at St. Botolph. First, the kitchenette is not completely family-friendly. For example, it was stocked with 12 or so champagne and wine glasses, but there was not a cereal bowl to be found. The plastic drinking glasses were so huge that they were unmanageable for smaller hands, and there was no trash can for kitchen trash. But the nearly full-size refrigerator/ freezer (with auto ice maker) was a tremendous asset, as were the toaster oven and two-burner stove top. The black rubber floor in the kitchenette and bathroom was probably not a great choice for a hotel room--they looked dirty, even when cleaned. As for sleeping arrangements, the Inn provided an Aerobed for our son at our request, but the bedroom was too small to accommodate it (also, the queen bed canopy-type frame was also way too big for such a small room, and made it difficult to move around in the room--a lower headboard/footboard configuration would have been more appropriate). Putting the Aerobed in the living room was impractical, given our varied sleep schedules. Finally, to be fully family-friendly, a bathtub instead of just a shower stall would have been helpful. The bathroom was clean and nicely arranged, and there was plenty of room on both sides of the sink to put our belongings. The towels and comfy bathrobe were of obviously high quality. We will definitely stay at the Inn at St. Botolph's again, and would recommend the hotel to others. But be aware that their cancellation policy dictates "no refund" if you cancel less than two weeks in advance, and it will cost you $50 if you cancel earlier than that.

Reviews.Title: “One Word - IMPRESSIVE!!!”
Reviews.Author: isneeeze
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve stayed at many different hotels in the past yet Iâ€™ve never cared enough to write a review for any of them. The Inn @ St. Botolph has wowâ€™ed me beyond belief â€“ Iâ€™m not exaggerating!! My fiancÃ© and I were in town visiting family during Thanksgiving â€“ Because we were surprising my folks we searched the web instead of asking for a recommendation. We werenâ€™t sure what to expect, but we sure were happy when we arrivedâ€¦ The hotel is a beautiful brownstone on the corner of St Botolph Street near the Prudential Center T stop and garage. GPS brought us right to the door, but the brick building didnâ€™t look like a typical hotel. We typed our access code and entered the hotel (we were exhausted and it was nice not having to â€œcheck-inâ€�). Immediately we knew the place was special. The walls were nicely painted in a sophisticated and welcoming hue of brown (which happens to be my favorite color). We found our room (#304) without a hitch. It was a studio - a surprisingly sizable one! My favorite decorations include the round ceiling fixture, the oversized wood blinds and drapery (so we could â€œblack outâ€� and sleep in), huge LG TV and full body mirror. The mirror for some reason made me look 15 pounds heavier though?? Anyways, we slept like a rock even though it wasnâ€™t â€œourâ€� bedâ€¦ oh, and the shower was just amazing!! It came down like a rain fallâ€¦ We woke up just before check out time and fortunately had time to go to the lounge. My partner had smoked tea and I had espresso. I have to say, as a coffee lover, I was more than pleased to find they had terrific coffee!! Not the drip kind you usually find, but real European flavorâ€¦ At breakfast we chatted with one of the hotel employees, Brendan, who was extremely friendly, not what I expected of someone working on a holiday! We totally got a steal (admittedly without expecting it). The value for my money was so well spent! The Inn has it all: great rooms, beeeautiful decorations, fantastic location with a staff that makes you feel at home. It was absolutely one of the most comfortable places I've ever stayed at. I really hope they donâ€™t raise their prices 'cause we will DEFINITELY be back!

Reviews.Title: “Had some issues -- but this Inn has great potential.”
Reviews.Author: Dcunard
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed several days at the Inn at St. Botolph and left feeling a bit disappointed. Let me start off by saying that the rooms are impeccable decorated. I looked through the pictures on this site and my room is pictures and looked exactly as shown -- gorgeous modern furniture and fine linens. But once you get past the appearance there are some basic flaws which make a several day visit at this price point annoying. I will start by listing the negative and needs improvement aspects of the Inn @ St Botolph and then finish the review with the positive aspects. 1) Absolutely no parking. I was warned of this by my secretary before arriving but was told it was easy to find. After driving several hours to Boston, I parked in front of the Innâ€™s building at 99 Botolph Street to get my several bags of luggage into the hotel and up the elevator to my room. I called the number on the room phone that said house manager (I believe it was room 109) and the gentleman who answered was very cold, uninformed and said that he didn't know where public parking was located and that the Inn Manager Ryan was not available. Very annoying -- so luckily my iPhone had "around me" feature and I was able to find the closest public parking garage about 1.5 blocks away. As this point â€“ 30 minutes had passed trying to get the directions and when I looked out the room window to the street there was already a $40 ticket on the windshield of my rental car for parking after 4PM in "Resident Only" meters.
